article:
Alfred A. Farland

Alfred A. Farland was a renowned American banjo player, composer, and music educator of the late 19th and early 20th centuries. He was a prominent figure in the development of classical banjo music and was known for his innovative approach to the instrument. Farland's contributions to the world of music are still celebrated today, and his legacy continues to inspire banjo enthusiasts and classical music aficionados alike.

# Background

Alfred A. Farland was born in 1864 in the United States. Little is known about his early life, but it is believed that he began playing the banjo at a young age. Farland's early musical influences were likely shaped by the popular music of the time, including minstrel shows and folk music. As he honed his skills, he became increasingly interested in classical music and its potential application to the banjo.

# Professional life

Farland's professional career as a musician began in the late 1880s, during which time he worked as a banjo soloist and accompanist. He performed with various musical ensembles, including orchestras and chamber groups, and quickly gained recognition for his technical skill and musicality. Farland's playing style was characterized by his use of classical techniques, such as fingerpicking and arpeggios, which set him apart from other banjo players of the time.

# Classical-music artist

Farland's passion for classical music led him to become one of the first banjo players to specialize in classical repertoire. He transcribed and arranged numerous classical pieces for the banjo, including works by composers such as Bach, Mozart, and Chopin. Farland's arrangements were highly regarded for their technical difficulty and musicality, and he became known as a leading exponent of classical banjo music.

# Marketing with his name

Farland was also a shrewd businessman, and he recognized the value of his name as a marketing tool. He began to use his name as a brand, applying it to a range of banjo-related products, including banjos, strings, and instructional materials. Farland's marketing efforts helped to establish him as a household name among banjo enthusiasts, and his products became highly sought after.

# American Banjo Fraternity

In 1900, Farland co-founded the American Banjo Fraternity, an organization dedicated to promoting the banjo and its music. The fraternity aimed to raise the profile of the banjo as a serious musical instrument and to provide a platform for banjo players to share their music and ideas. Farland served as the fraternity's first president and played a key role in shaping its activities and policies.

# Works

Farland was a prolific composer and arranger, and his works include a wide range of pieces for solo banjo and banjo ensemble. His music is characterized by its technical difficulty, musicality, and innovative use of banjo techniques.

## Educational

Farland was also a dedicated music educator, and he wrote several instructional books and methods for the banjo. His most famous work, "The Farland Banjo Method," is still used today by banjo students and teachers around the world. The method provides a comprehensive introduction to banjo playing, covering topics such as technique, music theory, and performance practice.

## Sheet music

Farland published numerous pieces of sheet music for the banjo, including solos, duets, and ensemble works. His music was highly regarded for its technical difficulty and musicality, and it remains popular among banjo players today. Many of Farland's compositions and arrangements are still in print, and they can be found in music stores and online.

# Gallery

A gallery of images related to Alfred A. Farland can be found below.

* Portrait of Alfred A. Farland
* Farland's banjo, c. 1900
* The American Banjo Fraternity, c. 1905
* Farland's method book, "The Farland Banjo Method"

# Examples in S.S. Stewart's Banjo and Guitar Journal

Farland's music and writings were frequently featured in S.S. Stewart's Banjo and Guitar Journal, a leading music publication of the time. The journal published numerous articles and compositions by Farland, including his famous arrangement of "The Blue Danube Waltz" for solo banjo.

This article does not include any citations or references.

article:
1970 ILTF Women's Tennis Circuit

The 1970 ILTF Women's Tennis Circuit was the third season of the International Lawn Tennis Federation's (ILTF) professional women's tennis circuit. The circuit consisted of 31 tournaments, including the four Grand Slam events, and was played from January to December 1970.

# Summary of season

The 1970 season saw the continued dominance of Margaret Court, who won 21 singles titles, including 11 of the 13 tournaments she entered in the first half of the year. Billie Jean King, who had risen to prominence in 1968, continued to challenge Court for the number one ranking, but ultimately finished the year as the second-ranked player. The season also saw the emergence of young players such as Evonne Goolagong and Virginia Wade, who would go on to become major champions in the years to come.

# Schedule

## January

The season began on January 5 with the Perth International in Australia, which was won by Margaret Court. The following week, the Australian Open was played in Sydney, with Court defeating Billie Jean King in the final. The tournament was notable for being the first Grand Slam event to offer equal prize money to men and women.

## February

In February, the circuit moved to South Africa, where Court won the South African Open in Johannesburg. The following week, the Federation Cup was held in Freiburg, West Germany, with Australia defeating West Germany in the final.

## March

In March, the circuit returned to the United States, with Court winning the US Indoor Championships in Winchester, Massachusetts. The following week, the Caribe Hilton International was played in San Juan, Puerto Rico, with Nancy Richey winning the singles title.

## April

In April, the circuit moved to Europe, with Court winning the Monte Carlo Open in Roquebrune-Cap-Martin, France. The following week, the Italian Open was played in Rome, with Court defeating Billie Jean King in the final.

## May

In May, the circuit returned to the United States, with Court winning the Atlanta Invitational in Atlanta, Georgia. The following week, the German Open was played in Hamburg, West Germany, with Helga Niessen Masthoff winning the singles title.

## June

In June, the circuit moved to the United Kingdom, with Margaret Court winning the Wills Open in Bristol. The following week, the Queen's Club Championships were played in London, with Ann Haydon-Jones winning the singles title.

## July

In July, the circuit moved to the United States, with Margaret Court winning the Western Open in Cincinnati, Ohio. The following week, the US Open was played in Forest Hills, New York, with Court defeating Rosemary Casals in the final.

## August

In August, the circuit moved to Canada, with Margaret Court winning the Canadian Open in Toronto. The following week, the Eastern Grass Court Championships were played in Orange, New Jersey, with Court defeating Patti Hogan in the final.

## September

In September, the circuit moved to Europe, with Margaret Court winning the Austrian Open in Kitzbühel. The following week, the Pacific Southwest Open was played in Los Angeles, California, with Billie Jean King winning the singles title.

## October

In October, the circuit returned to the United States, with Margaret Court winning the Midland Open in Midland, Texas. The following week, the Dewar Cup was played in Perth, Scotland, with Ann Haydon-Jones winning the singles title.

## November

In November, the circuit moved to South America, with Margaret Court winning the South American Open in Buenos Aires, Argentina. The following week, the British Indoor Championships were played in London, with Ann Haydon-Jones winning the singles title.

## December

In December, the circuit returned to Australia, with Evonne Goolagong winning the Victorian Open in Melbourne. The following week, the New South Wales Open was played in Sydney, with Margaret Court winning the singles title.

# Notes

* This article only includes tournaments that were part of the ILTF Women's Tennis Circuit.
* The rankings and statistics are based on the official ILTF rankings and tournament results.

article:
2300 Arena
================

The 2300 Arena is a multipurpose indoor arena located in South Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The venue has a rich history dating back to the 1920s and has been used for various purposes, including professional wrestling, boxing, mixed martial arts, concerts, and cultural events.

History
--------

### 1920–1985: Freight house

The 2300 Arena was originally built in the 1920s as a freight house for the Pennsylvania Railroad. The building was used for loading and unloading cargo and was an essential part of the city's transportation infrastructure. Over the years, the building underwent several renovations and expansions to accommodate the growing needs of the railroad.

### 1986–2002: South Philly Vikings management

In 1986, the building was acquired by the South Philly Vikings, a local sports organization. The Vikings converted the freight house into a sports arena, installing seating, lighting, and sound systems. The venue became a popular spot for local sports teams and events.

#### Extreme Championship Wrestling residency, 1993–2001

In 1993, the 2300 Arena became the home of Extreme Championship Wrestling (ECW), a professional wrestling promotion. ECW was known for its hardcore style of wrestling, and the 2300 Arena became synonymous with the promotion. During its residency, ECW hosted numerous pay-per-view events, including the infamous "Barely Legal" and "Anarchy Rulz" events.

### 2002–2003: Xtreme Pro Wrestling management

In 2002, the 2300 Arena was acquired by Xtreme Pro Wrestling (XPW), another professional wrestling promotion. XPW continued to host wrestling events at the venue, but its residency was short-lived.

### 2004–2012: Roger Artigiani management

In 2004, the 2300 Arena was acquired by Roger Artigiani, a local businessman. Artigiani invested heavily in the venue, renovating the interior and exterior of the building.

#### Peltz and Hand residency, 2004–2009

In 2004, the 2300 Arena became the home of Peltz and Hand Boxing Promotions, a professional boxing promotion. Peltz and Hand hosted numerous boxing events at the venue, featuring top fighters from around the world.

#### Asylum Fight League naming rights, 2010–2012

In 2010, the 2300 Arena partnered with Asylum Fight League, a mixed martial arts promotion. As part of the partnership, the venue was renamed the "Asylum Arena" for Asylum Fight League events.

### 2012–2013: Arena Operating, LLC management

In 2012, the 2300 Arena was acquired by Arena Operating, LLC, a local management company. Arena Operating continued to host events at the venue, including concerts and mixed martial arts events.

### 2013–present: Roger Artigiani management

In 2013, Roger Artigiani regained ownership of the 2300 Arena. Artigiani has continued to invest in the venue, hosting a wide range of events, including professional wrestling, boxing, mixed martial arts, and concerts.

The 2300 Arena is home to the Hardcore Hall of Fame, a museum dedicated to the history of professional wrestling. The hall of fame features memorabilia and exhibits on some of the greatest wrestlers in history.

Bar 2300 is a full-service bar located inside the 2300 Arena. The bar offers a wide range of drinks and snacks, and is open during events.

article:
**Samnites**

The Samnites were an ancient Italic people who lived in Samnium, a region in central and southern Italy, from the 6th to the 1st centuries BC. They were a significant force in the Mediterranean world during the Roman Republic period and played a crucial role in shaping the region's history, culture, and politics.

**Etymology**

The term "Samnite" is derived from the Latin word "Samnites," which is itself derived from the Oscan word "Safinim," meaning "those from Safinum." Safinum was the name of a city in Samnium, and the term eventually came to refer to the entire ethnic group.

**History**

### Origins and early history

The origins of the Samnites are shrouded in mystery, but it is believed that they were an Indo-European-speaking people who migrated to Italy from the north in the 6th century BC. They settled in the Apennine Mountains, where they developed a distinct culture and identity. The Samnites were a rural, agricultural people who lived in small villages and towns, and their early history was marked by constant conflict with their neighbors, including the Etruscans and the Latins.

### Samnite Wars

The Samnite Wars were a series of conflicts between the Samnites and the Romans that lasted from 343 to 290 BC. The wars were sparked by Roman expansion into Samnite territory, and they resulted in the eventual defeat of the Samnites and the incorporation of their territory into the Roman Republic. The Samnite Wars were significant because they marked the beginning of Roman expansion in Italy and the development of the Roman army into a powerful and disciplined fighting force.

### Later history

After their defeat in the Samnite Wars, the Samnites continued to play an important role in Italian politics and culture. Many Samnites were integrated into the Roman Republic, and they served as soldiers, administrators, and politicians. The Samnites also maintained their own distinct culture and identity, and they continued to practice their own language, customs, and traditions. In the 1st century BC, the Samnites joined the Social War, a rebellion against Roman rule, but they were ultimately defeated and their territory was incorporated into the Roman Empire.

**Society**

### Economy

The Samnite economy was based on agriculture, and the Samnites were skilled farmers who grew crops such as wheat, barley, and grapes. They also raised livestock, including cattle, pigs, and sheep. The Samnites were known for their high-quality wool, which was highly prized by the Romans. The Samnites also engaged in trade, and they exported goods such as wine, olive oil, and metalwork to other regions of Italy.

### Government

The Samnite government was a complex system of tribal councils and assemblies. Each Samnite tribe had its own council of elders, which made decisions on behalf of the tribe. The Samnites also had a system of elected officials, including a meddix, who served as the head of the tribe. The Samnites were known for their democratic system of government, which allowed for the participation of all citizens in the decision-making process.

### Military

The Samnite military was a powerful and disciplined fighting force. The Samnites were known for their skill in hand-to-hand combat, and they used a variety of tactics, including ambushes and guerrilla warfare. The Samnite military was also known for its use of armor and weaponry, which was of high quality and often decorated with intricate designs.

#### Armor

The Samnites used a variety of armor, including helmets, breastplates, and greaves. Their armor was often decorated with intricate designs and symbols, which were used to identify the wearer's tribe and status. The Samnites also used shields, which were made of wood or metal and were often decorated with feathers and other ornaments.

#### Weaponry

The Samnites used a variety of weapons, including swords, spears, and javelins. Their swords were often decorated with intricate designs and were used for both battle and ceremonial purposes. The Samnites also used bows and arrows, which were used for hunting and warfare.

**Culture**

### Religion

The Samnite religion was a complex system of beliefs and practices that were centered on the worship of a variety of gods and goddesses. The Samnites believed in a number of deities, including Jupiter, Mars, and Venus, and they built temples and shrines to honor these gods. The Samnites also practiced animal sacrifice and divination, and they believed in the importance of omens and auguries.

### Gender roles

The Samnites had a complex system of gender roles, which varied depending on the tribe and the individual. In general, women played an important role in Samnite society, and they were allowed to own property and participate in the decision-making process. However, women were also expected to fulfill traditional roles, such as managing the household and raising children.

### Art

The Samnites were skilled artists, and they produced a variety of art forms, including pottery, sculpture, and metalwork. Their art was often decorated with intricate designs and symbols, which were used to identify the artist and the tribe. The Samnites also produced a number of famous artworks, including the statue of the goddess Venus, which was discovered in the 19th century.

### Clothing

The Samnites wore a variety of clothing, including tunics, cloaks, and sandals. Their clothing was often decorated with intricate designs and symbols, which were used to identify the wearer's tribe and status. The Samnites also wore jewelry, including necklaces, earrings, and rings, which were often decorated with precious stones.

### Recreation

The Samnites enjoyed a variety of recreational activities, including hunting, fishing, and sports. They were also known for their love of music and dance, and they often held festivals and celebrations to honor their gods and goddesses.

### Cities and engineering

The Samnites built a number of cities and towns, which were often fortified with walls and towers. They were skilled engineers, and they built roads, bridges, and aqueducts to support their cities and towns. The Samnites also built a number of famous landmarks, including the temple of Jupiter at Pietrabbondante, which was discovered in the 19th century.

**Notable Samnites**

### Leaders of the Samnites

* Gaius Pontius, a Samnite general who led the Samnites to victory against the Romans in the 3rd century BC.

article:
2022 FIVB Men's Volleyball World Championship

The 2022 FIVB Men's Volleyball World Championship was the 20th edition of the FIVB Volleyball Men's World Championship, the world championship for national volleyball teams organized by the Fédération Internationale de Volleyball (FIVB). The tournament was held in Poland and Slovenia from August 26 to September 11, 2022.

# Host selection

The host selection process for the 2022 FIVB Men's Volleyball World Championship began in 2018, with the FIVB announcing that it would be accepting bids from interested countries until May 2019. In November 2019, the FIVB announced that Poland and Slovenia had been selected as the co-hosts of the tournament, marking the first time that the event would be held in two countries.

# Qualification

A total of 24 teams qualified for the tournament, with the top 12 teams from the 2018 FIVB Volleyball Men's World Championship qualifying automatically, along with the top 2 teams from each of the 5 continental confederations. The remaining 5 teams were selected through a wild card process.

# Format

The tournament featured a preliminary round, where the 24 teams were divided into 6 pools of 4 teams each, with each team playing the other teams in their pool once. The top 2 teams from each pool, along with the top 4 third-placed teams, advanced to the final round, which consisted of a round of 16, quarterfinals, semifinals, and the final.

## Preliminary round

The preliminary round was held from August 26 to September 4, 2022, with the teams playing each other in a round-robin format.

## Final round

The final round was held from September 5 to September 11, 2022, with the teams competing in a single-elimination format.

# Pools composition

The 24 teams were divided into 6 pools of 4 teams each, based on their FIVB World Rankings.

# Squads

Each team was allowed to select a squad of 14 players for the tournament.

# Venues

The tournament was held in 7 venues across Poland and Slovenia, including the Spodek Arena in Katowice and the Arena Stožice in Ljubljana.

# Pool standing procedure

The teams were ranked in each pool based on the number of wins, with the team having the most wins being ranked first. In the event of a tie, the teams were ranked based on their points ratio, with the team having the highest points ratio being ranked first.

# Preliminary round

## Pool A

Pool A was held in Katowice, Poland, and featured the teams from Brazil, Cuba, Japan, and Qatar.

## Pool B

Pool B was held in Ljubljana, Slovenia, and featured the teams from France, Germany, Italy, and Poland.

## Pool C

Pool C was held in Gliwice, Poland, and featured the teams from Argentina, Iran, Netherlands, and Serbia.

## Pool D

=========================

Miss Grand Thailand 2022 was the 10th edition of the Miss Grand Thailand pageant, held on April 30, 2022, at the Central World in Bangkok, Thailand. The pageant was organized by MGI (Miss Grand International) Organization, led by Nawat Itsaragrisil, and was broadcast live on Channel 7. The event was attended by over 5,000 guests, including beauty queens, celebrities, and pageant enthusiasts.

Background
----------

### Location and date

The pageant was held at the Central World in Bangkok, Thailand, on April 30, 2022. The venue was chosen for its central location and state-of-the-art facilities, which could accommodate a large audience and provide a comfortable environment for the contestants.

#### Preliminary competition

The preliminary competition was held on April 29, 2022, and was attended by a panel of judges. The contestants were evaluated on their physical appearance, personality, and stage presence.

#### Grand final coronation

The grand final coronation was held on April 30, 2022, and was attended by over 5,000 guests. The contestants were evaluated on their final performances, and the winner was announced.

# 2023 World Matchplay

The 2023 World Matchplay was a professional darts tournament held at the Winter Gardens in Blackpool, England. The event was organized by the Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) and took place from July 15 to July 23, 2023. It was the 30th edition of the World Matchplay, one of the most prestigious events in the PDC calendar.

## #Prize money
The total prize fund for the 2023 World Matchplay was £800,000, with the winner receiving £200,000. The runner-up took home £100,000, while the losing semi-finalists received £50,000 each. The prize money was distributed as follows:

* Winner: £200,000
* Runner-up: £100,000
* Semi-finalists: £50,000
* Quarter-finalists: £30,000
* Second round: £20,000
* First round: £10,000

The 2023 World Matchplay featured the top 16 players from the PDC Order of Merit, plus 16 qualifiers from the ProTour Order of Merit. The tournament was played in a knockout format, with each match being played over a best-of-legs format. The first round was played over 19 legs, the second round and quarter-finals over 21 legs, and the semi-finals and final over 31 legs.

## #Qualification
The qualification process for the 2023 World Matchplay was based on the PDC Order of Merit and the ProTour Order of Merit. The top 16 players from the PDC Order of Merit automatically qualified for the event, while the remaining 16 places were taken by the top 16 players from the ProTour Order of Merit who were not already qualified.

article:
FBI Search of Mar-a-Lago

The FBI search of Mar-a-Lago was a law enforcement operation conducted by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) on August 8, 2022, at Mar-a-Lago, the private club and residence of former U.S. President Donald Trump in Palm Beach, Florida. The search was part of an investigation into the handling of presidential records, including classified documents, and the potential violation of federal laws.

# Background

## Handling, storage, and disposition of U.S. government records

The handling, storage, and disposition of U.S. government records are governed by federal laws and regulations. The Presidential Records Act of 1978 requires the President to preserve and maintain records of their administration, and to transfer them to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) at the end of their term. The Federal Records Act of 1950 requires federal agencies to maintain and preserve records, and to follow proper procedures for their disposal.

### Criminal laws listed on search warrant

The search warrant executed at Mar-a-Lago listed several federal statutes, including 18 U.S.C. § 793 (gathering, transmitting, or losing defense information), 18 U.S.C. § 2071 (concealment, removal, or mutilation of documents), and 18 U.S.C. § 1519 (destruction, alteration, or falsification of records in federal investigations).

### Classified material and the presidency

The handling of classified material is a critical aspect of national security. The President has the authority to classify and declassify information, but this authority is subject to regulations and guidelines.

#### Declassification, presidential powers and regulations

The President's power to declassify information is derived from Executive Order 13526, which governs the classification and declassification of national security information. The order requires the President to follow specific procedures for declassifying information, including consulting with relevant agencies and following established guidelines.

#### Protocols for loss or compromise of classified material

In the event of a loss or compromise of classified material, the relevant agency must follow established protocols to report and investigate the incident. This includes notifying the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) and the Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI).

# Events leading to the search

## NARA actions to retrieve presidential records from Mar-a-Lago

In January 2022, the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) requested that the Trump Organization return presidential records that had been removed from the White House at the end of Trump's term.

### Partial return of records to NARA

In February 2022, Trump returned a portion of the records to NARA, but the agency later determined that some records were still missing.

### Trump's statement regarding return of records

Trump issued a statement claiming that all records had been returned to NARA, but the agency disputed this claim.

### NARA makes criminal referral

In February 2022, NARA referred the matter to the Department of Justice (DOJ) for investigation, citing concerns about the handling of presidential records.

### Tom Fitton's advice to Trump

Tom Fitton, the president of Judicial Watch, advised Trump to resist efforts by NARA to retrieve the records, citing concerns about the agency's authority and potential biases.

## FBI/DOJ launches criminal investigation and issues subpoenas

In April 2022, the FBI and DOJ launched a criminal investigation into the handling of presidential records, and issued subpoenas to Trump's lawyers and the Trump Organization.

### May 2022 subpoena

In May 2022, the FBI issued a subpoena to Trump's lawyer, seeking documents related to the handling of presidential records.

### June 2022 subpoena

In June 2022, the FBI issued a second subpoena to Trump's lawyer, seeking additional documents and records.

## FBI/DOJ obtains search warrant from federal court

On August 5, 2022, the FBI obtained a search warrant from a federal court, authorizing the search of Mar-a-Lago for evidence related to the handling of presidential records.

# Search of Mar-a-Lago

On August 8, 2022, the FBI executed the search warrant at Mar-a-Lago, searching for evidence related to the handling of presidential records. The search was conducted by a team of FBI agents, who were accompanied by a U.S. attorney and a court-authorized monitor.

## Search of other Trump properties

There were reports of searches being conducted at other Trump properties, including Trump Tower in New York City and the Trump National Golf Club in Bedminster, New Jersey.

# Release of search warrant, property receipt, and affidavit

## Release of search warrant and property receipt

On August 12, 2022, the search warrant and property receipt were unsealed and released to the public.

### Seized materials

The property receipt listed several seized materials, including boxes of documents, binders, and a "leather-bound box."

### Missing materials

The property receipt also listed several missing materials, including a "container of documents" and a "folder of documents."

## Motions to release search warrant affidavit

There were several motions filed to release the search warrant affidavit, which had been sealed by the court.

## Release of redacted search warrant affidavit

On August 26, 2022, a redacted version of the search warrant affidavit was released to the public.

## Release of detailed property list

On September 2, 2022, a detailed property list was released to the public, listing the specific items that had been seized during the search.

# Trump v. United States

On August 22, 2022, Trump filed a lawsuit against the United States, seeking to block the use of the seized materials in the investigation.

# Special counsel investigation

On November 18, 2022, Attorney General Merrick Garland appointed a special counsel to oversee the investigation into the handling of presidential records.

## Indictment

There were reports of a potential indictment of Trump, but this had not been confirmed as of the writing of this article.

# Reactions

## Congress

There were mixed reactions to the search from members of Congress, with some Democrats praising the investigation and some Republicans condemning it as a "witch hunt."

## White House

The White House issued a statement saying that it had not been involved in the investigation, and that it would not comment on ongoing law enforcement matters.

## National Archives

NARA issued a statement saying that it had cooperated fully with the investigation, and that it was committed to preserving and maintaining presidential records.

## Trump, his family, and his attorneys

### Claims of political motivation, planted evidence, and Obama precedent

Trump and his allies claimed that the search was motivated by politics, and that evidence had been planted to frame him. They also cited a precedent set by former President Barack Obama, who had removed records from the White House at the end of his term.

### Claims of declassifying all documents

Trump claimed that he had declassified all of the documents that had been seized during the search, but this claim was disputed by experts and officials.

### Lawsuit

Trump filed a lawsuit against the United States, seeking to block the use of the seized materials in the investigation.

## Trump allies and supporters

### Threats against government officials

There were reports of threats being made against government officials, including FBI agents and judges, by Trump allies and supporters.

### FBI field office attack

On August 11, 2022, an FBI field office in Cincinnati, Ohio was attacked by a man who was reportedly angry about the search of Mar-a-Lago.

## Republican elected officials and candidates

There were mixed reactions to the search from Republican elected officials and candidates, with some praising Trump and others condemning the investigation.

## Congressional Democrats

Congressional Democrats largely praised the investigation, and called for Trump to be held accountable for his actions.

## Scholars and former officials

Scholars and former officials weighed in on the investigation, with some praising the FBI's actions and others criticizing them.

## Intelligence community

The intelligence community was reportedly involved in the investigation, and had provided information to the FBI about the handling of classified material.

## Former Trump administration figures

Former Trump administration figures, including former Attorney General Jeff Sessions and former Secretary of State Mike Pompeo, weighed in on the investigation, with some praising Trump and others condemning him.

2022–23 I-League 2nd Division

The 2022–23 I-League 2nd Division is the 15th season of the I-League 2nd Division, the second tier of Indian football. The season began on 25 January 2023 and is scheduled to conclude on 2 April 2023.

Changes from last season

The 2022–23 season sees several changes from the previous season. The league has been expanded to 20 teams, divided into four groups of five teams each. The teams will play each other in a round-robin format, with the top team from each group qualifying for the final round. The final round will feature the four group winners, who will play each other in a round-robin format to determine the champions.

Qualification

Selection criteria

Teams can qualify for the I-League 2nd Division through various routes. The top teams from each state league are eligible to participate in the qualification tournament. Additionally, reserve teams of I-League and Indian Super League clubs are also eligible to participate.

Teams selection through state leagues

A total of 13 teams qualified for the qualification tournament through their respective state leagues. The state leagues were held between August and October 2022, with the top teams from each league qualifying for the qualification tournament.

Reserve teams

Four reserve teams of I-League and Indian Super League clubs participated in the qualification tournament. These teams were Bengaluru FC B, Kerala Blasters B, Mumbai City FC B, and Hyderabad FC B.

The qualification tournament was held from 24 November to 15 December 2022. The 17 teams were divided into two groups of eight and nine teams each. The top two teams from each group qualified for the I-League 2nd Division.

article:
Fort Amsterdam
================

Fort Amsterdam was a Dutch colonial fort located on the southern tip of Manhattan Island in what is now Lower Manhattan, New York City. The fort played a significant role in the early history of New York City and was a key location in the colonial era.

History
-------

### Establishment (1621–1660)

In 1621, the Dutch West India Company granted a charter to the New Netherland Company to establish a settlement on Manhattan Island. The company's director, Willem Verhulst, arrived on the island in 1624 and began construction of a fort, which was named Fort Amsterdam. The fort was built to protect the Dutch colony from potential threats from the English and Native American tribes.

The fort was constructed using local materials, including wood and stone, and was designed to be a simple, yet effective, defensive structure. It was surrounded by a palisade, a wooden fence, and had several bastions, or strongpoints, to provide additional protection.

Over the years, the fort was expanded and improved, with the addition of new buildings, including a church, a governor's house, and a number of private residences. The fort became the center of the Dutch colony, and its strategic location allowed it to control access to the Hudson River and the surrounding area.

### English rule (1664–1673)

In 1664, the English sent a fleet to New Amsterdam, and the Dutch colony was surrendered without a fight. The English renamed the colony New York, after the Duke of York, who had been granted a charter to the colony by his brother, King Charles II.

During the English period, Fort Amsterdam was used as a military base and was occupied by English soldiers. The fort was also used as a place of imprisonment for those who opposed English rule, including several prominent Dutch colonists.

### Dutch rule (1673–1674)

In 1673, the Dutch recaptured New York and Fort Amsterdam was once again under Dutch control. However, the Dutch period was short-lived, and in 1674, the English regained control of the colony.

### English rule (1674–1689)

During the second English period, Fort Amsterdam was once again used as a military base and was occupied by English soldiers. The fort was also used as a place of imprisonment for those who opposed English rule, including several prominent Dutch colonists.

In 1689, a group of colonists, who were dissatisfied with English rule, seized control of Fort Amsterdam and declared their independence from England. This event marked the beginning of a period of colonist rule in New York.

### Colonist rule (1689–1691)

During the period of colonist rule, Fort Amsterdam was used as a seat of government and was occupied by the colonists. The fort was also used as a place of imprisonment for those who opposed colonist rule.

In 1691, the English regained control of New York and Fort Amsterdam was once again under English control.

### British rule (1691–1775)

During the British period, Fort Amsterdam was used as a military base and was occupied by British soldiers. The fort was also used as a place of imprisonment for those who opposed British rule.

In the years leading up to the American Revolution, tensions between the British and the colonists continued to rise. The British imposed a number of taxes on the colonists, including the Stamp Act and the Townshend Acts, which were deeply unpopular.

### Prelude to the revolution

In 1774, a group of colonists, who were dissatisfied with British rule, formed the Sons of Liberty, a radical group that was dedicated to resisting British rule. The Sons of Liberty were responsible for a number of protests and demonstrations, including the Boston Tea Party, which was a major event in the lead-up to the American Revolution.

### Colonist rule (1775–1776)

In 1775, the American Revolution began, and the colonists seized control of Fort Amsterdam. The fort was used as a military base and was occupied by colonial soldiers.

In 1776, the Declaration of Independence was signed, and the United States of America was officially established.

### British rule (1776–1783)

Despite the Declaration of Independence, the British continued to occupy New York and Fort Amsterdam. The fort was used as a military base and was occupied by British soldiers.

In 1783, the Treaty of Paris was signed, which officially ended the American Revolution and recognized American independence. The British withdrew from New York and Fort Amsterdam, and the fort was abandoned.

### American rule (1783–1790)

After the British withdrew, Fort Amsterdam was abandoned and fell into disrepair. In 1790, the fort was demolished, and the site was used for other purposes.

Kenzō Shirai

Kenzō Shirai is a Japanese former artistic gymnast who competed at the international level. He is best known for his incredible achievements on the floor exercise and vault apparatus, where he has won numerous world and Olympic medals. Shirai is widely regarded as one of the greatest gymnasts of all time, and his impressive skills and techniques have inspired a generation of gymnasts.

#Early life

Kenzō Shirai was born on August 24, 1996, in Yokohama, Japan. He began training gymnastics at the age of four, following in the footsteps of his older brother, who was also a gymnast. Shirai's parents were supportive of his gymnastics career from the start, and he trained extensively throughout his childhood and adolescence.

#Career

##2013

Shirai's international career began in 2013, when he competed at the World Gymnastics Championships in Antwerp, Belgium. He was just 17 years old at the time and was still a junior gymnast. Despite his youth, Shirai impressed observers with his incredible skills and technique on the floor exercise and vault apparatus.

##2014

In 2014, Shirai continued to make a name for himself on the international stage. He competed at the World Gymnastics Championships in Nanning, China, where he won his first world medal – a bronze on the floor exercise. Shirai's performance was notable for its incredible difficulty and precision, and he quickly established himself as one of the top gymnasts in the world.

##2015

The 2015 season was a breakout year for Shirai. He competed at the World Gymnastics Championships in Glasgow, Scotland, where he won two gold medals – one on the floor exercise and one on the vault. Shirai's performances were breathtaking, and he solidified his position as one of the top gymnasts in the world.

##2016

The 2016 season was a significant one for Shirai, as it marked the beginning of the Olympic qualification process. Shirai competed at the Pacific Rim Gymnastics Championships in Everett, Washington, where he won three gold medals – one on the floor exercise, one on the vault, and one in the all-around.

###2016 Summer Olympics

Shirai's crowning achievement came at the 2016 Summer Olympics in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. He competed in the men's artistic gymnastics competition, where he won a gold medal on the floor exercise and a bronze medal on the vault. Shirai's performances were incredible, and he helped Japan win a bronze medal in the team competition.

##2017

In 2017, Shirai continued to compete at the top level. He won two gold medals at the World Gymnastics Championships in Montreal, Canada – one on the floor exercise and one on the vault. Shirai's performances were notable for their incredible difficulty and precision, and he solidified his position as one of the top gymnasts in the world.

##2018

The 2018 season was a challenging one for Shirai, as he struggled with injuries and form issues. Despite these challenges, he continued to compete at the top level and won several medals at the World Gymnastics Championships in Doha, Qatar.

##2019

In 2019, Shirai rebounded from his struggles in 2018 and had a successful season. He competed at the World Gymnastics Championships in Stuttgart, Germany, where he won two gold medals – one on the floor exercise and one on the vault.

##2020/2021

The 2020/2021 season was a difficult one for Shirai, as the COVID-19 pandemic forced the cancellation of many competitions. Despite these challenges, Shirai continued to train and compete, and he won several medals at the All-Japan Championships.

###Injuries and retirement

In 2021, Shirai announced his retirement from competitive gymnastics due to a series of injuries and health issues. He had struggled with ankle and shoulder injuries throughout his career, and he ultimately decided that it was time to step away from the sport.

#Competitive history

Shirai's competitive history is extensive and impressive. He has competed at numerous World Championships and Olympic Games, and he has won numerous medals on the floor exercise and vault apparatus.

#Eponymous skills

Shirai has two skills named after him in the Code of Points – the "Shirai" on the floor exercise and the "Shirai 2" on the vault. These skills are notable for their incredible difficulty and precision, and they have been performed by few gymnasts.

#Miscellaneous

Shirai is known for his charismatic personality and his impressive skills and techniques. He has been an inspiration to many gymnasts around the world, and he will be remembered as one of the greatest gymnasts of all time.

article:
2022 Israeli Legislative Election

The 2022 Israeli legislative election was held on November 1, 2022, to elect the 25th Knesset, the unicameral parliament of Israel. The election was the fifth to be held in less than four years, following the 2019 and 2020 elections, which failed to produce a stable government, and the 2021 election, which resulted in a short-lived government.

#Background

The 2022 Israeli legislative election was necessitated by the collapse of the 36th government of Israel, led by Prime Minister Naftali Bennett, in June 2022. The government, which was formed in June 2021 after the 2021 election, was a coalition of eight parties with diverse ideologies, ranging from the right-wing Yamina to the left-wing Meretz. The coalition was plagued by internal divisions and disagreements, particularly over issues related to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the role of religion in the state.

In June 2022, the government lost its majority in the Knesset after a member of the coalition, Ghaida Rinawie Zoabi, resigned from the coalition and joined the opposition. The opposition, led by the Likud party, subsequently passed a no-confidence motion, dissolving the government and triggering new elections.

#Campaign

The campaign for the 2022 Israeli legislative election began in earnest in July 2022, with the announcement of the election date. The campaign was marked by a series of debates and television appearances by the leaders of the major parties, as well as a significant amount of social media activity.

The campaign focused on a number of key issues, including the economy, security, and the role of religion in the state. The Likud party, led by former Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, campaigned on a platform of economic growth and security, while the center-left parties, including the Labor party and Meretz, focused on issues related to social justice and the environment.

The far-right parties, including the Religious Zionist party and the Otzma Yehudit party, campaigned on a platform of nationalism and security, while the Arab parties, including the United Arab List and the Hadash party, focused on issues related to the Israeli-Palestinian conflict and the rights of Arab citizens of Israel.

#Timeline

* June 29, 2022: The 36th government of Israel collapses after losing its majority in the Knesset.
* July 10, 2022: The Knesset votes to dissolve itself, triggering new elections.
* July 14, 2022: The Central Elections Committee sets the election date for November 1, 2022.
* August 15, 2022: The deadline for parties to submit their lists of candidates.
* October 25, 2022: The start of the election campaign on television and radio.
* November 1, 2022: Election day.

#Electoral System

Beergate
================

Beergate is a British political controversy that emerged in 2022, surrounding an alleged breach of COVID-19 lockdown rules by Labour Party leader Keir Starmer and Deputy Leader Angela Rayner. The controversy centers around a gathering at a Labour Party office in Durham, England, on April 30, 2021, during which food and beer were reportedly consumed.

Durham Event
-------------

On April 30, 2021, Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner attended a gathering at the Labour Party's office in Durham, which was also the constituency office of Labour MP Mary Foy. The event was initially described as a work meeting, with Starmer and Rayner reportedly working on the local election campaign. However, it was later alleged that the gathering involved food and beer, which was not permitted under the COVID-19 lockdown rules in place at the time.

Video Footage
-------------

In January 2022, video footage emerged showing Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner drinking beer and eating food at the Durham office. The footage was obtained by the Daily Mail and appeared to contradict the initial characterization of the event as a work meeting.

Response to Partygate
-------------------

The Beergate controversy emerged in the context of the Partygate scandal, which involved allegations of COVID-19 rule-breaking by government officials, including Prime Minister Boris Johnson. The Labour Party had been critical of the government's handling of the pandemic and had called for Johnson's resignation over the Partygate scandal.

Initial Police Review
--------------------

In January 2022, Durham Constabulary announced that it would review the circumstances surrounding the Durham event to determine whether any COVID-19 rules had been broken. The review was described as a "fact-finding exercise" to establish the facts of the case.

### Calls for Further Investigation

### Start of Investigation

The investigation began in early May 2022, with police officers speaking to witnesses and gathering evidence.

### New Allegations

During the investigation, new allegations emerged that the Durham event had involved a larger number of people than initially reported, and that food and drink had been served throughout the evening.

### Starmer's and Rayner's Resignation Pledges

In response to the allegations, Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner announced that they would resign as Labour leader and deputy leader if they were found to have broken COVID-19 rules. The pledges were seen as an attempt to demonstrate the Labour Party's commitment to accountability and transparency.

### Responses to Pledges

### Police Questionnaires

As part of the investigation, police officers distributed questionnaires to attendees at the Durham event, seeking information about their activities on the evening of April 30, 2021.

### Outcome

On July 8, 2022, Durham Constabulary announced that it had concluded its investigation into the Durham event and had found no evidence of COVID-19 rule-breaking. The investigation found that the gathering had been a legitimate work meeting, and that food and drink had been served in a way that was consistent with the COVID-19 rules in place at the time.

### Responses to the Outcome

The Labour Party welcomed the outcome of the investigation, with Keir Starmer and Angela Rayner stating that they had been vindicated by the findings. The Conservative Party responded by criticizing the investigation, citing concerns that it had been inadequate and that the Labour Party had not been held to account for its actions.

Battle of Sievierodonetsk (2022)

The Battle of Sievierodonetsk was a major military engagement fought between Ukrainian government forces and Russian-backed separatists, with support from the Russian military, during the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. The battle took place in and around the city of Sievierodonetsk, which is the administrative center of the Sievierodonetsk Raion in the Luhansk Oblast of eastern Ukraine.

# Background

Sievierodonetsk is a strategically important city located near the border with Russia and has been a key stronghold for Ukrainian forces in the region. Prior to the 2022 invasion, the city had a population of around 105,000 people and was a major industrial and economic center in eastern Ukraine. The city's location made it a crucial point for controlling the surrounding region, and its capture would provide a significant advantage to the side that controls it.

In the months leading up to the invasion, there were reports of a significant buildup of Russian troops and military equipment near the Ukrainian border. On February 24, 2022, Russia launched a large-scale invasion of Ukraine, with troops advancing on multiple fronts. The Ukrainian military responded quickly, and fierce fighting broke out across the country.

# Battle

## Encirclement attempts

In the early stages of the battle, Russian-backed separatists and Russian troops attempted to encircle Sievierodonetsk, cutting off supply lines and escape routes for Ukrainian forces. However, Ukrainian troops managed to hold their ground, and the city remained under their control. The Ukrainians also launched counterattacks, pushing back against the Russian advance and retaking some lost territory.

## Attack on the city

Despite the initial failure to encircle the city, Russian troops continued to push forward, launching a series of attacks on Sievierodonetsk. The city came under heavy artillery and rocket fire, causing significant damage to buildings and infrastructure. Ukrainian forces responded with their own artillery and missile strikes, targeting Russian positions and supply lines.

## Ukraine rejects surrender ultimatum

On June 15, 2022, Russian forces issued an ultimatum to Ukrainian troops in Sievierodonetsk, demanding that they surrender and lay down their arms. However, the Ukrainians rejected the ultimatum, vowing to continue fighting for control of the city. The Ukrainian government stated that it would not negotiate with Russia while the country was under attack.

## Fall of Sievierodonetsk

After weeks of intense fighting, Russian troops finally breached the defenses of Sievierodonetsk on June 25, 2022. Ukrainian forces retreated from the city, and Russian troops took control of the remaining territory. The fall of Sievierodonetsk marked a significant turning point in the battle, as Russian forces had now gained control of a major urban center in eastern Ukraine.

# Aftermath

The capture of Sievierodonetsk gave Russian forces a significant advantage in the region, allowing them to launch further attacks on Ukrainian-held territory. The Ukrainian government vowed to retake the city, but it remains under Russian control to this day.

The battle also had significant humanitarian consequences, with thousands of civilians displaced or forced to flee their homes. The city suffered significant damage, with many buildings and infrastructure destroyed or damaged.

# Casualties

Estimates of casualties during the battle vary widely, with both sides suffering significant losses. Ukrainian officials reported that hundreds of Russian troops were killed or injured, while Russian officials claimed that Ukrainian forces suffered heavy casualties.

# Analysis

The Battle of Sievierodonetsk was a significant turning point in the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine, marking a major shift in momentum in favor of Russian forces. The capture of the city gave Russian troops a strategic advantage in the region, allowing them to launch further attacks on Ukrainian-held territory.

The battle also highlighted the significant challenges facing Ukrainian forces, who have been fighting a well-equipped and well-trained enemy. Despite being outgunned and outmanned, Ukrainian troops managed to hold their ground for weeks, inflicting significant casualties on Russian forces.

article:
Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness
=============================================

Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness is a 2022 American superhero film based on the Marvel Comics character Doctor Strange. Produced by Marvel Studios and distributed by Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures, it is the sequel to Doctor Strange (2016) and the 28th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU).

Plot
-----

The film follows Doctor Strange (Benedict Cumberbatch), who, after the events of Spider-Man: No Way Home, must face the consequences of his actions. He seeks the help of Wanda Maximoff (Elizabeth Olsen), also known as the Scarlet Witch, who has become increasingly powerful and unstable. The two embark on a journey through the multiverse, visiting different realities and timelines, in search of a way to stop a mysterious threat.

Along the way, they encounter various versions of themselves and other characters from the MCU, including America Chavez (Xochitl Gomez), a young Latina superhero with the ability to punch holes through dimensions. As they navigate the ever-changing landscape of the multiverse, they must confront their own demons and make difficult choices that will have far-reaching consequences.

Cast
-----

* Benedict Cumberbatch as Doctor Strange
* Elizabeth Olsen as Wanda Maximoff / Scarlet Witch
* Xochitl Gomez as America Chavez
* Benedict Wong as Wong
* Chiwetel Ejiofor as Mordo
* Michael Stuhlbarg as Nicodemus West
* Rachel McAdams as Christine Palmer

Production
------------

### Development

Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was first announced in December 2018, with Scott Derrickson set to return as director and writer. However, in January 2020, Derrickson left the project due to creative differences, and Sam Raimi was brought on board to take over. Raimi had previously directed the original Spider-Man trilogy and had been a fan of the Doctor Strange comics.

### Pre-production

Pre-production on the film began in February 2020, with a script written by Michael Waldron, who had previously worked on the Disney+ series Loki. The film's budget was estimated to be around $200 million, making it one of the most expensive films in the MCU.

### Filming

Principal photography began on November 4, 2020, at Longcross Studios in Surrey, England. Filming took place over several months, with the cast and crew working under strict COVID-19 protocols. The film's cinematography was handled by John Mathieson, who had previously worked on the Bond film Skyfall.

### Post-production

Post-production on the film began in March 2021, with Raimi working closely with the visual effects team to bring the film's complex action sequences to life. The film's score was composed by Danny Elfman, who had previously worked on the Spider-Man films.

Music
------

The film's score was composed by Danny Elfman, who incorporated elements of the Doctor Strange theme from the first film. The score was performed by the London Symphony Orchestra and was released on May 6, 2022.

Marketing
----------

The marketing campaign for Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness began in December 2021, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer showed glimpses of the film's complex action sequences and introduced the concept of the multiverse. A second trailer was released in February 2022, which showed more of the film's plot and characters.

Release
--------

### Theatrical

Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness was released in theaters on May 6, 2022, in the United States. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, and was also available in Dolby Cinema and ScreenX.

### Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on June 22, 2022, and on Blu-ray and DVD on July 26, 2022.

Reception
----------

### Box office

### Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising its visuals and action sequences. The film holds a 74% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 6.5/10.

### Accolades

Albury & District Football League

The Albury & District Football League is a minor Australian rules football competition based in New South Wales, Australia. The league was established in 1951 and features teams from the Albury-Wodonga region, as well as surrounding areas. The competition has a rich history and has produced many talented players who have gone on to compete at higher levels.

# History

The Albury & District Football League was formed in 1951, following the decision of the Albury Football League to expand its competition to include teams from surrounding areas. The original teams to compete in the league were Albury, Corowa, East Albury, Lavington, North Albury, and South Albury. Over the years, the league has undergone several changes, including the addition of new teams and the departure of existing ones.

In the early years of the competition, the league struggled to gain momentum, with many teams experiencing financial difficulties and struggling to field competitive sides. However, the league persevered, and by the 1960s, it had established itself as a strong and stable competition.

In the 1970s and 1980s, the league experienced a period of significant growth, with the addition of new teams and the introduction of new rules and competitions. The league also began to attract more talented players, many of whom went on to compete at higher levels.

In recent years, the league has continued to evolve, with the introduction of new competitions and initiatives aimed at promoting the game and developing young players. Despite facing challenges, including declining player numbers and increasing competition from other sports, the league remains a vibrant and important part of the Albury-Wodonga sporting community.

## Notable Moments

* 1951: The Albury & District Football League is formed, with six teams competing in the inaugural season.
* 1961: The league introduces its first finals series, with Albury defeating Corowa in the grand final.
* 1971: The league expands to include teams from surrounding areas, including Culcairn and Henty.
* 1981: The league introduces its first reserves competition, providing opportunities for young players to develop their skills.
* 1991: The league celebrates its 40th anniversary, with a number of events and activities held throughout the season.
* 2001: The league introduces its first under-18 competition, providing opportunities for young players to develop their skills.

# Former Clubs

Over the years, several clubs have competed in the Albury & District Football League. Some of the former clubs include:

* Albury Rovers: Competed in the league from 1951 to 1961, before merging with Albury.
* Corowa Stars: Competed in the league from 1951 to 1971, before folding due to financial difficulties.
* Culcairn: Competed in the league from 1971 to 1991, before joining the Farrer Football League.
* Henty: Competed in the league from 1971 to 1981, before folding due to financial difficulties.

article:
June 2022 Afghanistan earthquake

On June 22, 2022, a powerful earthquake struck southeastern Afghanistan, causing widespread destruction and loss of life. The disaster was one of the deadliest earthquakes to hit the country in recent years, and it drew international attention and aid.

# Earthquake

## Tectonic setting

The June 2022 Afghanistan earthquake occurred in a region of high seismic activity. Afghanistan is located in the Himalayan seismic zone, where the Indian tectonic plate is colliding with the Eurasian plate. This collision has resulted in the formation of several major fault lines, including the Chaman Fault, which runs along the border with Pakistan. The region is also home to several other significant fault lines, including the Kabul Fault and the Herat Fault.

## Characteristics

The earthquake had a magnitude of 5.9 on the Richter scale and a depth of approximately 10 kilometers (6.2 miles). It was a shallow earthquake, with its epicenter located in the Paktika Province of Afghanistan. The earthquake was of a thrust type, meaning that the ground on one side of the fault was pushed up relative to the ground on the other side.

## Intensity

The intensity of the earthquake was significant, with reports of widespread destruction and damage to buildings and infrastructure. The earthquake was felt as far away as Islamabad, Pakistan, and New Delhi, India.

## Aftershocks

Several aftershocks were reported in the hours and days following the earthquake, with magnitudes ranging from 3.0 to 4.0. These aftershocks caused additional damage and anxiety for those affected by the initial earthquake.

# Impact

## Afghanistan

The earthquake had a devastating impact on Afghanistan, particularly in the southeastern provinces of Paktika and Khost. Reports indicated that thousands of homes were destroyed or damaged, leaving many families without access to basic necessities like shelter, food, and water. The earthquake also damaged critical infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and hospitals.

The Afghan government reported that over 1,000 people were killed in the earthquake, with many more injured. The true extent of the damage and loss of life may never be known, as many areas of the country are remote and inaccessible.

## Pakistan

The earthquake was also felt in Pakistan, particularly in the northwestern provinces of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Punjab. Reports indicated that several buildings were damaged, and a few people were injured. However, the impact on Pakistan was relatively minor compared to Afghanistan.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of the earthquake was marked by widespread devastation and a massive humanitarian response. Rescue teams and aid workers from around the world rushed to the affected areas to provide assistance.

# Domestic response

The Afghan government responded quickly to the disaster, with President Ashraf Ghani declaring a state of emergency and deploying troops to assist with the relief efforts. The government also appealed for international aid to support the affected populations.

# International response

## United States

The United States was among the first countries to respond to the disaster, with Secretary of State Antony Blinken announcing a $55 million aid package to support the Afghan people. The US also deployed a team of disaster response experts to assist with the relief efforts.

## International organizations

Several international organizations, including the United Nations, the Red Cross, and the European Union, also responded to the disaster with aid and assistance. The UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) reported that over $100 million in aid had been pledged to support the affected populations.

The women's cricket tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was held in Hangzhou, China from September 19 to September 24, 2023. The tournament featured eight teams from across Asia, competing in a Twenty20 format. This was the second time that cricket was included in the Asian Games, after its debut in 2010.

# Squads

Each team was required to submit a squad of 15 players. The following teams and players participated in the tournament:

article:
Shazam! Fury of the Gods

Shazam! Fury of the Gods is a 2023 American superhero film directed by David F. Sandberg and written by Henry Gayden and Chris Morgan. It is the sequel to the 2019 film Shazam! and the 12th film in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU). The film stars Zachary Levi, Asher Angel, Jack Dylan Grazer, and Rachel Zegler.

# Plot

The film takes place after the events of the first film, where Billy Batson (Asher Angel) has become a superhero known as Shazam (Zachary Levi). However, he soon finds himself facing a new threat from the gods, who are angry at him for using his powers for personal gain. The gods, led by the goddess Hespera (Helen Mirren), decide to take away Shazam's powers and destroy the world.

Meanwhile, Billy's friends and family are struggling to cope with their own personal issues. Mary Bromfield (Grace Fulton) is trying to balance her superhero life with her college life, while Freddy Freeman (Jack Dylan Grazer) is trying to find his place in the world. The family soon discovers that the gods are planning to destroy the world and that they must work together to stop them.

As the gods launch their attack on the world, Shazam and his family must use all their skills and powers to defend the earth. Along the way, they meet a new ally, a teenage girl named Anthea (Rachel Zegler), who has the power to control the gods. Together, they embark on a quest to stop the gods and save the world.

# Cast

* Zachary Levi as Shazam / Billy Batson
* Asher Angel as Billy Batson
* Jack Dylan Grazer as Freddy Freeman
* Rachel Zegler as Anthea
* Helen Mirren as Hespera
* Lucy Liu as Kalypso
* Djimon Hounsou as Shazam
* Faithe Herman as Darla Dudley
* Ian Chen as Eugene Choi
* Jovan Armand as Pedro Pena
* Marta Milans as Rosa Vasquez
* Cooper Andrews as Victor Vasquez
* Grace Fulton as Mary Bromfield

# Production

## Development

In 2019, it was announced that a sequel to Shazam! was in development, with Henry Gayden set to return as writer. The film was initially set to be released in 2022, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the release date was pushed back to 2023.

## Pre-production

In August 2020, it was announced that Chris Morgan would co-write the script with Gayden. The film's budget was estimated to be around $100 million.

## Filming

Principal photography began on May 31, 2021, in Atlanta, Georgia. The film was shot using a combination of practical and visual effects. The cast and crew worked closely together to ensure that the film's tone and style were consistent with the first film.

## Post-production

Post-production began in October 2021, with the film's editor, Michel Aller, working closely with director David F. Sandberg to ensure that the film's pacing and tone were consistent. The visual effects team, led by Bill Westenhofer, worked on creating the film's epic action sequences and supernatural creatures.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Christophe Beck, who also composed the score for the first film. The soundtrack features a mix of classic rock and pop songs, including "Thunder" by Imagine Dragons and "Best Day of My Life" by American Authors.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in October 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured a mix of action-packed sequences and comedic moments, showcasing the film's tone and style. The film's official trailer was released in January 2023, featuring a more in-depth look at the film's plot and characters.

# Release

## Theatrical

Shazam! Fury of the Gods was released in theaters on March 17, 2023. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, as well as in standard theaters.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on May 23, 2023, and on DVD and Blu-ray on June 20, 2023.

According to reports, Cavalcante and Reis had a dispute over a business deal gone sour, which led to the fatal shooting. Cavalcante denied any involvement in the crime, but evidence pointed to his guilt.

He settled in the state of Florida, where he assumed a new identity and began working odd jobs to support himself. According to reports, Cavalcante and Brandão had a romantic relationship, but it ended violently when Cavalcante allegedly strangled her to death. Spare (memoir)
================

Spare is a memoir written by Prince Harry, Duke of Sussex, which was published on January 10, 2023. The book is a personal account of Prince Harry's life, covering his childhood, his military career, his relationships, and his decision to step back from his role as a working member of the British royal family.

Background and writing
---------------------

Prince Harry began writing Spare in 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic. He worked with ghostwriter J.R. Moehringer, who is known for his work on memoirs such as Andre Agassi's Open and Nike founder Phil Knight's Shoe Dog. The book was written in secrecy, with only a few people knowing about the project. Prince Harry has stated that he wrote the book to tell his story and to provide a more nuanced understanding of his life and experiences.

Synopsis
--------

### Childhood and Diana's death

The book begins with Prince Harry's childhood, describing his close relationship with his mother, Diana, Princess of Wales. He recounts fond memories of their time together, including vacations and special events. The book also delves into the difficulties of his childhood, including the media scrutiny and the challenges of being a member of the royal family. Prince Harry writes about the traumatic experience of losing his mother in a car accident in Paris in 1997, and the emotional aftermath of her death.

### Teenage years, drug use, and deployment to Afghanistan

Prince Harry describes his teenage years as a time of rebellion and experimentation. He writes about his use of marijuana and cocaine, and the challenges of navigating his relationships with his family members. He also recounts his decision to join the British Army, and his deployment to Afghanistan in 2007-2008. Prince Harry writes about the experiences he had during his time in Afghanistan, including the camaraderie with his fellow soldiers and the difficulties of dealing with the physical and emotional toll of war.

### Relationship with Charles and Camilla, William's wedding, and Caroline Flack

The book explores Prince Harry's complicated relationship with his father, Charles, Prince of Wales, and his stepmother, Camilla, Duchess of Cornwall. He writes about the tension and distance that developed between them over the years, particularly after his mother's death. Prince Harry also recounts his experience of attending his brother William's wedding to Catherine Middleton in 2011, and the media attention that surrounded the event. The book also touches on Prince Harry's friendship with Caroline Flack, the British television presenter who took her own life in 2020.

### Relationship with Meghan and fatherhood

Prince Harry writes about meeting his wife, Meghan Markle, and the early days of their relationship. He describes the intense media scrutiny that they faced, and the challenges of navigating their relationship in the public eye. The book also explores Prince Harry's experience of becoming a father to their son, Archie Mountbatten-Windsor, and the joy and challenges that come with parenthood.

### Stepping back from royal role

The book concludes with Prince Harry's decision to step back from his role as a working member of the royal family. He writes about the factors that led to this decision, including the media scrutiny, the lack of support from his family, and the desire to create a more peaceful and private life for himself and his family.

Release
-------

Spare was published on January 10, 2023, by Penguin Random House. The book was released in multiple formats, including hardcover, e-book, and audiobook. The book's release was highly anticipated, with many media outlets and bookstores promoting the book in the days leading up to its release.

Reception
----------

### Sales

Spare debuted at number one on the New York Times bestseller list, selling over 1.4 million copies in its first week of release. The book also reached number one on the Amazon bestseller list, and was the fastest-selling non-fiction book in the UK since records began. The book's success was attributed to the public's fascination with the British royal family, as well as the controversy surrounding Prince Harry's decision to step back from his royal role.

### Critical response

The critical response to Spare was mixed. Some reviewers praised Prince Harry's writing style and the book's candid portrayal of his life experiences. Others criticized the book for being too self-indulgent and lacking in nuance. The book's portrayal of the royal family was also a subject of controversy, with some reviewers feeling that Prince Harry was too critical of his family members.

### Afghanistan comments

Prince Harry's comments about his time in Afghanistan were widely reported and sparked controversy. He wrote about killing 25 Taliban fighters, and described the experience as a "normal" part of war. Some critics felt that Prince Harry's comments were insensitive and glamorized war.

### Discussions on mental health

The book's discussion of mental health was widely praised. Prince Harry wrote about his own struggles with anxiety and depression, and the importance of seeking help and support. The book's portrayal of mental health was seen as a positive step towards reducing stigma and promoting awareness.

### Political response

The book's release sparked a political response, with some politicians criticizing Prince Harry's decision to write about his family and his experiences in the royal family. Others defended Prince Harry's right to tell his story and praised the book's candid portrayal of life in the royal family.

### Public opinion

Public opinion on the book was divided. Some readers praised Prince Harry's honesty and the book's insight into life in the royal family. Others felt that the book was too self-indulgent and that Prince Harry was being disloyal to his family. The book's release sparked a wider debate about the role of the royal family and the media's treatment of them.

Guts (Olivia Rodrigo album)

Guts is the upcoming second studio album by American singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo, announced on June 27, 2023. The album is set to be released on September 8, 2023, through Geffen Records and Interscope Records. Following the massive success of her debut album Sour (2021), Rodrigo began working on Guts, which marks a new direction in her music career.

#Background

In January 2022, Rodrigo revealed that she was working on new music, stating that she had been writing songs since the release of Sour. Throughout the year, she continued to share updates on her social media, hinting at a potential new album. After a successful world tour in support of Sour, Rodrigo took some time off to focus on her personal life and songwriting.

The title Guts was announced on June 27, 2023, along with the release date and a series of cryptic promotional images. The title has been interpreted by fans as a reflection of Rodrigo's personal growth and increased confidence in her music.

#Writing and recording

Rodrigo wrote or co-wrote all the songs on Guts, collaborating with various producers and songwriters. She has stated that the album is a more experimental and introspective work, exploring themes of love, relationships, and self-discovery.

Recording sessions for Guts took place in various studios in Los Angeles and New York City. Rodrigo worked with producers Dan Nigro, who also produced Sour, as well as new collaborators such as Max Martin and Shellback.

#Music

##Lyrics

The lyrics on Guts are characterized by Rodrigo's signature storytelling style, with vivid imagery and poetic metaphors. The album's lyrics explore themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery, with a focus on Rodrigo's personal experiences and emotions.

Rodrigo has stated that the album is a reflection of her growth as a person and an artist, with songs that are more experimental and introspective than her previous work.

#Release and promotion

##Cover artwork

The cover artwork for Guts features a close-up image of Rodrigo's face, with a bold, red lip color and a introspective expression. The image has been interpreted by fans as a representation of Rodrigo's increased confidence and self-awareness.

##Singles

The lead single from Guts, "Bad Idea Right?", was released on July 11, 2023, along with a music video. The song features a catchy, pop-infused melody and lyrics that explore the theme of toxic relationships.

A second single, "Ballad of a Homeschooled Girl", was released on August 15, 2023, with a music video that pays homage to classic coming-of-age films.

##Marketing

Geffen Records and Interscope Records launched a comprehensive marketing campaign for Guts, including social media promotions, influencer partnerships, and a series of cryptic teasers.

Rodrigo also partnered with various brands, including Spotify and Apple Music, to promote the album and share exclusive content with her fans.

##Tour

Rodrigo announced a world tour in support of Guts, which is set to kick off in 2024. The tour will feature a new stage design and production, with a focus on showcasing the album's themes and music.

##Guts: The Secret Tracks

A deluxe edition of Guts, titled Guts: The Secret Tracks, was announced on August 22, 2023. The edition features three additional tracks, including a collaboration with American singer-songwriter Phoebe Bridgers.

#Critical reception

Guts has received widespread critical acclaim, with praise for Rodrigo's songwriting, production, and vocals. Reviewers have noted the album's experimental and introspective sound, as well as its exploration of themes that are both personal and universal.

##Year-end lists

Guts has been included on several year-end lists, including Rolling Stone's "Best Albums of 2023" and Billboard's "Top 10 Albums of 2023".

#Commercial performance

Guts debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart, with over 300,000 album-equivalent units sold in its first week. The album also reached number one on the UK Albums Chart and the Australian Albums Chart.

#Accolades

Guts has been nominated for several awards, including the Grammy Award for Album of the Year and the American Music Award for Favorite Pop/Rock Album.
