article:
2022 United States Elections

The 2022 United States elections were held on November 8, 2022, with various federal, state, and local elections taking place across the country. The elections were seen as a referendum on the presidency of Joe Biden and the Democratic Party's control of Congress. The Republican Party sought to regain control of the Senate and House of Representatives, while Democrats aimed to maintain their majorities.

# Background

The 2022 elections were the first midterm elections of Joe Biden's presidency. The elections were also the first to take place after the COVID-19 pandemic and the 2021 United States Capitol attack. The elections saw a significant increase in early voting and mail-in ballots, with many states expanding their voting laws to accommodate the changes.

# Campaign

The 2022 election campaign was marked by intense partisan rivalry, with both parties spending record amounts on advertising and get-out-the-vote efforts. The campaign also saw a number of high-profile endorsements and celebrity appearances.

## Primaries

The primary elections took place from March to September 2022, with both parties holding contests in all 50 states. The primaries saw a number of incumbent members of Congress facing challenges from within their own parties, while others chose to retire or seek higher office.

## Issues

A number of issues dominated the 2022 campaign, including the economy, abortion, crime and gun violence, democracy, education, climate change, immigration, student loan forgiveness, and the presidency of Joe Biden.

### Economy

The economy was a major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to stimulate economic growth and reduce inflation. Republicans argued that Democratic policies, such as the American Rescue Plan, had led to inflation and hurt small businesses. Democrats countered that their policies had helped to recover from the COVID-19 pandemic and create jobs.

### Abortion

Abortion was a highly contentious issue in the 2022 campaign, following the Supreme Court's decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, which overturned Roe v. Wade. Democrats argued that the decision was a threat to women's rights and promised to codify abortion rights into law. Republicans argued that the decision was a victory for the unborn and promised to restrict abortion access.

### Crime and Gun Violence

Crime and gun violence were also major issues in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to reduce crime rates and prevent mass shootings. Democrats argued that stricter gun control laws were needed to prevent gun violence, while Republicans argued that more law enforcement funding and support for mental health services were needed.

### Democracy

The health of American democracy was also a major issue in the 2022 campaign, following the 2021 United States Capitol attack and ongoing efforts to restrict voting rights. Democrats argued that Republican efforts to restrict voting rights and overturn election results were a threat to democracy, while Republicans argued that their efforts were necessary to prevent voter fraud.

### Education

Education was another major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to improve student outcomes and reduce the cost of higher education. Democrats argued that more funding for public schools and student loan forgiveness were needed, while Republicans argued that school choice and vocational training programs were the key to improving education.

### Climate Change

Climate change was also a major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to reduce carbon emissions and transition to renewable energy. Democrats argued that more investment in clean energy and stricter regulations on fossil fuels were needed, while Republicans argued that more drilling and pipeline construction were needed to reduce energy costs.

### Immigration

Immigration was another major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to secure the border and provide a pathway to citizenship for undocumented immigrants. Democrats argued that a more humane approach to immigration was needed, while Republicans argued that stricter border security and more deportations were needed.

### Student Loan Forgiveness

Student loan forgiveness was also a major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to reduce the burden of student loan debt on borrowers. Democrats argued that more forgiveness programs and income-driven repayment plans were needed, while Republicans argued that more private sector solutions and vocational training programs were needed.

### Presidency of Joe Biden

The presidency of Joe Biden was also a major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the success of his policies and his leadership style. Democrats argued that Biden had achieved significant successes, such as the American Rescue Plan and the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, while Republicans argued that his policies had led to inflation and hurt the economy.

### Russian Invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine was also a major issue in the 2022 campaign, with both parties debating the best way to support Ukraine and deter Russian aggression. Democrats argued that more military aid and economic sanctions were needed, while Republicans argued that more diplomatic efforts and support for NATO were needed.

## Campaign Spending

The 2022 campaign saw record amounts of spending, with both parties and outside groups spending billions of dollars on advertising, get-out-the-vote efforts, and other campaign activities.

# Federal Elections

## Senate Elections

The 2022 Senate elections saw 35 seats up for election, with Democrats defending 15 seats and Republicans defending 20 seats.

### Special Elections

There were several special elections held in 2022 to fill vacant Senate seats.

### Post-Election Party Switches

There were several party switches after the election, with some members switching from Republican to Democrat and others switching from Democrat to Republican.

## House of Representatives Elections

The 2022 House of Representatives elections saw all 435 seats up for election, with Democrats defending 220 seats and Republicans defending 215 seats.

### Special Elections

There were several special elections held in 2022 to fill vacant House seats.

# State Elections

## Gubernatorial Elections

The 2022 gubernatorial elections saw 36 seats up for election, with Democrats defending 16 seats and Republicans defending 20 seats.

## Other State Executive Elections

There were several other state executive elections held in 2022, including lieutenant governor, attorney general, and secretary of state.

## State Judicial Elections

There were several state judicial elections held in 2022, including supreme court and appellate court seats.

## Legislative Elections

There were several state legislative elections held in 2022, with Democrats and Republicans competing for control of state senates and houses of representatives.

## Referendums

There were several referendums held in 2022, including votes on abortion, marijuana, and voting rights.

# Local Elections

There were several local elections held in 2022, including mayoral and city council elections.

# Tribal Elections

There were several tribal elections held in 2022, including elections for tribal council and tribal chair.

The 2022 elections saw several significant outcomes, including the Republican Party's gain of control of the House of Representatives and the Democratic Party's retention of control of the Senate.

## Results

The final results of the election were:

* Senate: 48 Democrats, 49 Republicans, 3 Independents
* House of Representatives: 213 Republicans, 222 Democrats
* Governor: 25 Republicans, 25 Democrats
* State Legislature: 22 Republican-controlled, 18 Democratic-controlled, 10 split

## January 2023 Speaker Election

The election for Speaker of the House of Representatives was held on January 3, 2023, with Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) ultimately winning the position after 15 rounds of voting.

## Analysis

The 2022 elections were widely analyzed by pundits and commentators, with several key takeaways:

### Close Results

The 2022 elections saw several close results, including the Senate elections in Arizona, Georgia, and Nevada, and the House elections in California, New York, and Texas.

### Demographic Trends

The 2022 elections saw several demographic trends, including the increasing importance of suburban voters and the growing diversity of the American electorate.

### Polling and Predictions by Pundits

The 2022 elections saw several notable polling and prediction errors by pundits and analysts, including the overestimation of Democratic performance in several Senate and House elections.

### Potential Green Wave

The 2022 elections saw a significant increase in environmental activism and concern about climate change, with several "green wave" candidates winning election to Congress and state legislatures.

### Speculation about 2024 Elections

The 2022 elections sparked significant speculation about the 2024 presidential and congressional elections, with several potential candidates already announcing their intentions to run.

### Turnout

The 2022 elections saw significant turnout, with over 120 million voters casting ballots in the general election.

# Firsts

The 2022 elections saw several historic "firsts", including:

* The first openly gay man to be elected to the Senate (Mark Pocan, D-WI)
* The first Muslim woman to be elected to the House of Representatives (Ilhan Omar, D-MN)
* The first Native American woman to be elected to the House of Representatives (Sharice Davids, D-KS)
* The first woman to be elected to the Senate from the state of Arizona (Kyrsten Sinema, D-AZ)

# Election Night Television Viewership

The 2022 elections saw significant television viewership, with over 70 million viewers tuning in to watch election coverage on major networks.

article:
Edwards Vacuum
================

Edwards Vacuum is a leading global manufacturer of vacuum pumps and abatement systems, with a rich history spanning over a century. The company has undergone significant transformations and changes in ownership, but its commitment to innovation and customer satisfaction has remained constant.

History
-------

### Independent (1919-1967)

Edwards Vacuum was founded in 1919 by F.D. Edwards in Grand Rapids, Michigan, USA. Initially, the company focused on producing vacuum pumps and gauges for the rapidly growing automotive industry. During the 1920s and 1930s, Edwards expanded its product line to cater to the needs of the emerging aerospace and defense sectors. The company's innovative designs and manufacturing techniques earned it a reputation as a reliable supplier of high-quality vacuum equipment.

### BOC (1968-2006)

In 1968, Edwards was acquired by the British Oxygen Company (BOC), a leading industrial gases and equipment supplier. Under BOC's ownership, Edwards continued to grow and expand its global presence. The company invested heavily in research and development, introducing new products and technologies that further solidified its position in the vacuum industry. During the 1970s and 1980s, Edwards became a major player in the emerging semiconductor market, providing critical vacuum equipment for the production of microchips.

### Linde and CCMP Capital (2006-2014)

In 2006, BOC was acquired by Linde AG, a German-based industrial gases company. Edwards became part of Linde's vacuum equipment division, which continued to operate under the Edwards brand. In 2010, CCMP Capital, a private equity firm, acquired a majority stake in Edwards from Linde. During this period, Edwards focused on expanding its presence in emerging markets, particularly in Asia.

### Atlas Copco (2014-present)

In 2014, Atlas Copco, a Swedish-based industrial equipment manufacturer, acquired Edwards Vacuum from CCMP Capital. The acquisition marked a significant milestone in Edwards' history, as it became part of a larger, global industrial equipment company. Under Atlas Copco's ownership, Edwards continues to operate as a standalone business, with a focus on innovation, customer satisfaction, and global expansion.

Products and Markets
-------------------

### 1950-60s

During the 1950s and 1960s, Edwards expanded its product line to cater to the growing needs of the aerospace and defense sectors. The company introduced new vacuum pump designs, including the popular EH and E2M series, which became industry standards. Edwards also began to supply vacuum equipment to the emerging semiconductor industry, which would become a major growth driver for the company in the decades to come.

### 1970s

The 1970s saw significant growth for Edwards, as the company continued to expand its presence in the semiconductor market. Edwards introduced new products, including vacuum pumps and abatement systems, designed specifically for the production of microchips. The company also began to supply vacuum equipment to the emerging medical and biotechnology sectors.

### 1980s

During the 1980s, Edwards continued to innovate, introducing new vacuum pump designs and technologies. The company's products played a critical role in the development of the microelectronics industry, as vacuum equipment became essential for the production of microchips. Edwards also expanded its presence in the industrial and research sectors, supplying vacuum equipment to universities, research institutions, and industrial companies.

### 1990s

The 1990s saw significant changes in the vacuum industry, as new technologies and products emerged. Edwards continued to innovate, introducing new vacuum pumps and abatement systems designed for the production of flat panel displays and other emerging technologies. The company also began to supply vacuum equipment to the growing solar and renewable energy sectors.

### Recent

In recent years, Edwards has continued to expand its product line and global presence. The company has introduced new vacuum pump designs, including the popular nEXT and GXS series, which offer improved performance and energy efficiency. Edwards has also invested heavily in research and development, focusing on emerging technologies such as nanotechnology and graphene production.

Edwards Lecture Series
---------------------

The Edwards Lecture Series is an annual event that brings together leading experts in the vacuum industry to discuss the latest developments and trends. The series was established in 2010 and has become a major event in the vacuum community, attracting attendees from around the world. The lectures cover a range of topics, from vacuum technology and applications to industry trends and market analysis.

Controversies
-------------

### Domain Registration

In 2013, Edwards was involved in a controversy surrounding the registration of the edwards.com domain name. The company had registered the domain name in the 1990s, but the registration had lapsed. A third-party company registered the domain name, leading to a dispute over ownership. The issue was eventually resolved in Edwards' favor, but not before the company had faced criticism for its handling of the situation.

### Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc

In 2011, Edwards was involved in a dispute with Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc, a US-based company that had been supplying vacuum equipment to Edwards. The dispute centered on allegations of patent infringement and trade secret theft. The issue was eventually resolved through a settlement, but not before both companies had faced significant costs and reputational damage.

References
----------

External Links
---------------

article:
John (given name)

John is a timeless and universal given name that has been a cornerstone of many cultures for centuries. Derived from the Hebrew name Yochanan, meaning "God is gracious," John has been a popular name across various languages and regions. This article explores the origins, statistics, and variations of the name John, as well as notable individuals who bear this name.

#Origins

The name John has its roots in ancient Hebrew, specifically from the name Yochanan, which was later adapted into Greek as Ioannes. The name gained widespread popularity in Europe during the Middle Ages, particularly after the Norman Conquest of England in 1066. The name John became a staple in English-speaking countries, and its various derivatives can be found in many languages.

##Germanic derivatives

The Germanic languages have their own adaptations of the name John, often with distinct spellings and pronunciations. Some examples include:

* German: Johann, Johannes, or Jan
* Dutch: Jan, Johan, or Joannes
* Scandinavian: Johan, Jens, or Jon
* Icelandic: Jón

These variations reflect the unique cultural and linguistic characteristics of each region, while still maintaining the essence of the original name.

#Name statistics

John has consistently been one of the most popular given names in many countries, particularly in the United States, the United Kingdom, and Canada. According to the United States Social Security Administration, John was the most popular boy name from 1880 to 1923, and remained in the top 10 until 1987. In the UK, John was the most popular boy name from 1954 to 1964.

In recent years, the name John has experienced a decline in popularity, but it remains a timeless and classic choice for parents. The enduring appeal of the name John can be attributed to its simplicity, versatility, and the numerous notable individuals who bear this name.

#In other languages

The name John has been adapted into various languages, often with unique spellings and pronunciations. Some examples include:

* French: Jean
* Spanish: Juan
* Italian: Giovanni
* Portuguese: João
* Russian: Ivan
* Chinese: (Yēhàn)
* Japanese: (Jon)

These variations demonstrate the widespread influence of the name John across cultures and languages.

##Royalty

Merenre Nemtyemsaf I
=====================

Merenre Nemtyemsaf I was an ancient Egyptian pharaoh of the 6th dynasty, ruling from approximately 2287 to 2181 BC. He is considered one of the most important rulers of the Old Kingdom, known for his extensive building projects, administrative reforms, and military campaigns.

Family
--------

### Parents and siblings

Merenre Nemtyemsaf I was the son of Pharaoh Pepi I and Queen Ankhesenpepi II. His father, Pepi I, was a prominent ruler who expanded Egypt's borders and established trade relationships with neighboring countries. Merenre's mother, Ankhesenpepi II, was a member of the royal family and played an important role in the court. Merenre had several siblings, including his half-brother Pepi II, who would eventually succeed him to the throne.

### Consorts and children

Merenre Nemtyemsaf I had several wives and children. One of his wives was a woman named Neith, who may have been a daughter of Pepi I. Merenre's children include a son named Pepi II, who would eventually become pharaoh, and several daughters, including Neith and Iput II.

Reign

article:
The Little Mermaid (2023 film)

The Little Mermaid is a 2023 American musical fantasy film directed by Rob Marshall, based on the 1837 fairy tale of the same name by Hans Christian Andersen. The film stars Halle Bailey as Ariel, a mermaid who dreams of exploring the world above the sea, and Jonah Hauer-King as Prince Eric, a human who falls in love with her. The film also features Melissa McCarthy, Javier Bardem, and Awkwafina in supporting roles.

#Plot

The film follows the story of Ariel, a young mermaid who lives under the sea with her father, King Triton, and her fish friends, Flounder and Scuttle. Ariel is fascinated by the world above the sea and collects human artifacts, much to the dismay of her father. One day, Ariel falls in love with Prince Eric, a human who is sailing on a ship. She rescues him from drowning and begins to make secret visits to the ship, where she and Eric begin to develop feelings for each other.

Ariel makes a deal with the sea witch, Ursula, to trade her voice for a pair of legs, allowing her to go on land and meet Eric. However, Ursula has her own motives and plans to use Ariel's voice to seduce Eric and marry him herself. Meanwhile, Eric is searching for the girl who saved him, but Ursula's spells and disguises lead him to believe that she is someone else.

As Ariel navigates the world above the sea, she must confront the challenges of being human and the obstacles that stand in her way of being with Eric. In the end, Ariel and Eric confess their love for each other, and Ursula's plans are foiled.

##Filming

The film's underwater scenes were filmed in a large tank in London, with the cast and crew using specialized equipment to create the illusion of being underwater.

##Visual effects

The film's visual effects were widely praised by critics, with many citing the film's use of CGI as one of its standout features.

The soundtrack was widely praised by critics, with many citing the film's music as one of its standout features. The soundtrack was also a commercial success, reaching number one on the US Billboard 200 chart and winning several awards, including the Academy Award for Best Original Song.

#Release

The film's marketing campaign began in 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer that featured Halle Bailey singing "Part of Your World". The trailer was widely praised by fans and critics, and generated a lot of buzz for the film.

In the months leading up to the film's release, Disney released several more trailers and promotional clips, featuring the film's cast and music. The film's marketing campaign was widely praised for its creativity and effectiveness.

##Home media

The film was released on home media in 2023, with a Blu-ray and DVD release that featured several bonus features, including deleted scenes and behind-the-scenes footage. The film was also released on digital platforms, including Amazon Prime and Disney+.

The film received a lot of attention and anticipation before its release, with many fans and critics expressing excitement and curiosity about the film's cast, music, and visual effects.

The film was a commercial success, grossing over $1 billion at the global box office. The film's opening weekend was particularly successful, with the film grossing over $100 million in the US and over $200 million worldwide.

The film received widely positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's cast, music, and visual effects. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 7.5/10.

The men's final was played on April 10, 2022, between Andy Baetens of Belgium and Thibault Tricole of France. Baetens won the match 6-5 in sets, claiming his first WDF World Championship title.

Pathaan (film)

Pathaan is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Siddharth Anand and produced by Aditya Chopra under the banner of Yash Raj Films. The film stars Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone, and John Abraham in lead roles. It is the fourth installment in the YRF Spy Universe and marks the return of Shah Rukh Khan to the big screen after a four-year hiatus.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Pathaan (Shah Rukh Khan), an Indian spy who is tasked with taking down a rogue agent named Jim (John Abraham) who has stolen a deadly virus and is threatening to unleash it on India. Along the way, Pathaan teams up with a Pakistani spy named Rubina (Deepika Padukone) who has her own reasons for wanting to take down Jim. As they navigate through the complex web of espionage and counter-terrorism, Pathaan and Rubina must confront their own pasts and work together to save the world from destruction.

# Production

## Development

The film was first announced in 2019, with Siddharth Anand set to direct and Shah Rukh Khan in the lead role. The script was written by Shridhar Raghavan, who had previously worked with Anand on the film "War". The story was inspired by real-life events and draws heavily from the world of espionage and counter-terrorism.

## Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first actor to be cast in the film, with Deepika Padukone and John Abraham joining the cast later. The film marks the fourth collaboration between Khan and Padukone, who had previously worked together on "Om Shanti Om", "Happy New Year", and "Chennai Express". Abraham was cast as the main antagonist, marking his first collaboration with Khan and Padukone.

## Filming

Principal photography for the film began in November 2020 and wrapped up in June 2022. The film was shot extensively in India, as well as in several international locations including Dubai, Abu Dhabi, and Budapest. The action sequences were choreographed by Yuen Woo-ping, who had previously worked on films like "The Matrix" and "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon".

# Music

The music for the film was composed by Vishal-Shekhar, with lyrics by Kumaar. The soundtrack features five tracks, including the hit single "Besharam Rang". The song was choreographed by Vaibhavi Merchant and features Khan and Padukone in a romantic dance sequence.

# Controversy

The film was embroiled in controversy before its release, with several groups calling for a boycott of the film due to its depiction of Hindu and Muslim characters. The film's trailer was also criticized for its perceived anti-Hindu and anti-Indian sentiments. However, the film's makers maintained that the film was a work of fiction and did not intend to offend any community.

# Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was one of the most extensive and expensive in Indian cinema history. The film's trailer was released in December 2022 and quickly went viral, with over 100 million views on YouTube. The film's posters and promotional materials featured Khan and Padukone prominently, with Abraham also featuring prominently as the main antagonist.

# Release

The film was released in theaters on January 25, 2023, in India and several other countries. The film received a wide release, with over 5,000 screens in India alone. The film was also released in several international markets, including the United States, the United Kingdom, and Australia.

## Home media

The film was released on home media platforms, including Amazon Prime Video, on April 10, 2023. The film was also released on DVD and Blu-ray in several countries.

# Reception

## Critical response

### India

The film received mixed reviews from Indian critics, with some praising the film's action sequences and performances, while others criticized the film's storyline and direction. The film holds a 60% approval rating on the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, based on 50 reviews, with an average rating of 5.8/10.

### International

The film received generally positive reviews from international critics, with many praising the film's action sequences and performances. The film holds a 70% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 20 reviews, with an average rating of 6.2/10.

## Box office

The film was a commercial success, grossing over ₹1,000 crore (US$130 million) worldwide. The film became the highest-grossing Indian film of 2023, surpassing the ₹800 crore (US$100 million) mark in India alone. The film also became the highest-grossing film of Shah Rukh Khan's career, surpassing the ₹500 crore (US$63 million) mark.

Football at the 2021 SEA Games – Men's tournament

The men's football tournament at the 2021 Southeast Asian Games was held from 6 to 22 May 2022 in Vietnam. The tournament was the 31st edition of the men's football tournament at the Southeast Asian Games, and the first to be held in Vietnam since 2003.

#Competition schedule

The tournament was scheduled to be held from 6 to 22 May 2022. The group stage matches were played from 6 to 16 May, while the knockout stage matches were played from 19 to 22 May.

#Venues

The tournament was held at four venues in Vietnam:

* Mỹ Đình National Stadium in Hanoi
* Hàng Đẫy Stadium in Hanoi
* Cẩm Phả Stadium in Quảng Ninh
* Phú Thọ Stadium in Phú Thọ

#Participating nations

A total of 9 teams participated in the tournament:

* Cambodia
* Indonesia
* Laos
* Malaysia
* Myanmar
* Philippines
* Singapore
* Thailand
* Vietnam

#Draw

The draw for the tournament was held on 6 April 2022 in Hanoi, Vietnam. The 9 teams were drawn into two groups of 5 teams and 4 teams, with the hosts Vietnam being placed in Group A.

#Squads

Each team was allowed to register a squad of 20 players.

#Group stage

The group stage was played from 6 to 16 May 2022. The teams were divided into two groups of 5 teams and 4 teams, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

##Group A

Group A was played from 6 to 16 May 2022. The teams in Group A were Vietnam, Indonesia, Malaysia, Cambodia, and Laos.

##Group B

Group B was played from 7 to 16 May 2022. The teams in Group B were Thailand, Myanmar, Philippines, Singapore, and Timor-Leste ( withdrew before the tournament).

#Knockout stage

The knockout stage was played from 19 to 22 May 2022.

##Semi-finals

The semi-finals were played on 19 May 2022.

##Bronze medal match

The bronze medal match was played on 22 May 2022.

* Malaysia 1 (3) - 1 (2) Myanmar

The gold medal match was played on 22 May 2022.

* Vietnam 1 - 0 Thailand

The winners of the tournament were Vietnam, who won their third SEA Games men's football title.

article:
Shinzo Abe
================

Shinzo Abe was a Japanese politician who served as the Prime Minister of Japan from 2006 to 2007 and again from 2012 to 2020. He was the longest-serving Prime Minister in Japanese history, and his tenure was marked by significant economic, foreign policy, and security initiatives.

Early Life
-----------

### Family

Shinzo Abe was born on September 21, 1954, in Tokyo, Japan. His family had a long history of involvement in politics. His father, Shintaro Abe, was a prominent politician and served as Foreign Minister from 1982 to 1986. His maternal grandfather, Nobusuke Kishi, was a former Prime Minister of Japan, serving from 1957 to 1960.

### Education and Early Career

Abe graduated from the prestigious Seikei University in 1977 with a degree in political science. After completing his education, he worked for the Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs and later became the executive assistant to the Minister for Foreign Affairs. In 1982, he joined the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP) and quickly rose through the ranks.

Member of the House of Representatives
---------------------------------------

Abe was first elected to the House of Representatives in 1993, representing the Yamaguchi 4th district. He served as the Deputy Chief Cabinet Secretary from 2000 to 2003 and later became the Secretary-General of the LDP in 2003. Abe's rise to prominence was swift, and he became a leading figure within the LDP.

First Term as Prime Minister (2006–2007)
-----------------------------------------

### Inauguration and Cabinet

Abe became the Prime Minister of Japan on September 26, 2006, succeeding Junichiro Koizumi. He formed a cabinet that included several experienced politicians, including Taro Aso as Foreign Minister and Sadakazu Tanigaki as Finance Minister.

### Domestic Policy

Abe's domestic policy initiatives focused on improving the economy and increasing national security. He introduced several measures to stimulate economic growth, including tax cuts and increased government spending on infrastructure projects. He also implemented policies aimed at increasing national security, including the creation of a new defense ministry.

### Foreign Policy

Abe's foreign policy initiatives focused on strengthening Japan's relationships with its regional neighbors and promoting its role as a global leader. He played a key role in promoting the concept of a "East Asian Community," which aimed to foster greater economic and security cooperation among regional countries.

#### North Korea

Abe's government took a tough stance on North Korea, which had been developing its nuclear program. He imposed economic sanctions on the country and supported international efforts to pressure North Korea to abandon its nuclear ambitions.

#### East and Southeast Asia

Abe strengthened Japan's relationships with its regional neighbors, including China, South Korea, and Southeast Asian countries. He promoted economic cooperation and trade agreements, including the Japan-ASEAN Comprehensive Economic Partnership.

#### India

Abe also strengthened Japan's relationship with India, which he saw as a key partner in promoting regional security and economic cooperation. He visited India in 2006 and signed several agreements aimed at promoting trade, investment, and security cooperation.

### Defense

Abe's government introduced several measures to strengthen Japan's defense capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry and the deployment of Japanese troops to Iraq in support of the US-led coalition.

### Resignation

Abe resigned as Prime Minister on September 12, 2007, citing health reasons. He was succeeded by Yasuo Fukuda.

Out of Office (2007–2012)
-------------------------

Abe remained a prominent figure in Japanese politics, serving as the LDP's Secretary-General from 2009 to 2012. He played a key role in promoting the party's policies and rebuilding its organization.

Second LDP Presidency and 2012 General Election
------------------------------------------------

Abe became the LDP's president again in 2012, and the party won the general election in December of that year. Abe became Prime Minister for the second time, succeeding Yoshihiko Noda.

Second Term as Prime Minister (2012–2014)
-----------------------------------------

### Economic Policy

Abe introduced several economic policies aimed at stimulating growth and increasing national competitiveness. His economic agenda, known as "Abenomics," included three main components:

#### "First Arrow": Monetary Policy

Abe introduced several monetary policy measures, including quantitative easing and negative interest rates, aimed at stimulating economic growth.

#### "Second Arrow": Fiscal Policy

Abe implemented several fiscal policy measures, including tax cuts and increased government spending, aimed at stimulating economic growth.

#### "Third Arrow": Growth Strategy and Structural Reform

Abe introduced several structural reforms aimed at increasing national competitiveness, including labor market reforms and trade agreements.

### 2013 Upper House Election

Abe's government won the Upper House election in 2013, giving him a majority in both houses of parliament.

### Domestic Policy

Abe's domestic policy initiatives focused on improving the economy and increasing national security. He introduced several measures to stimulate economic growth, including tax cuts and increased government spending on infrastructure projects.

### Foreign Policy

Abe's foreign policy initiatives focused on strengthening Japan's relationships with its regional neighbors and promoting its role as a global leader. He played a key role in promoting the concept of a "East Asian Community," which aimed to foster greater economic and security cooperation among regional countries.

### Defense and Security Policy

Abe's government introduced several measures to strengthen Japan's defense capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry and the deployment of Japanese troops to support international peacekeeping efforts.

### 2014 Cabinet Reshuffle

Abe reshuffled his cabinet in 2014, appointing several new ministers, including Fumio Kishida as Foreign Minister.

### 2014 General Election

Abe's government won the general election in 2014, giving him a majority in both houses of parliament.

Third Term as Prime Minister (2014–2017)
-----------------------------------------

### Foreign Policy

Abe's foreign policy initiatives focused on strengthening Japan's relationships with its regional neighbors and promoting its role as a global leader. He played a key role in promoting the concept of a "East Asian Community," which aimed to foster greater economic and security cooperation among regional countries.

### Security and Defense Issues

Abe's government introduced several measures to strengthen Japan's defense capabilities, including the creation of a new defense ministry and the deployment of Japanese troops to support international peacekeeping efforts.

### Re-election as LDP President and "Abenomics 2.0"

Abe was re-elected as LDP president in 2015, and he introduced "Abenomics 2.0," a new economic agenda aimed at stimulating growth and increasing national competitiveness.

### Constitutional Revision

Abe's government introduced several constitutional revisions aimed at increasing national security and promoting Japan's role as a global leader.

Fourth Term as Prime Minister (2017–2020)
-----------------------------------------

### Re-election as LDP President

Abe was re-elected as LDP president in 2017, and he became the longest-serving Prime Minister in Japanese history.

### Favoritism Scandals

Abe's government was involved in several favoritism scandals, including the Moritomo Gakuen scandal, which led to criticism of Abe's leadership.

### Foreign Policy

Abe's foreign policy initiatives focused on strengthening Japan's relationships with its regional neighbors and promoting its role as a global leader. He played a key role in promoting the concept of a "East Asian Community," which aimed to foster greater economic and security cooperation among regional countries.

### Economic Policy

Abe's economic policy initiatives focused on stimulating growth and increasing national competitiveness. He introduced several measures to promote trade and investment, including the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership.

### Whaling

Abe's government faced criticism for its whaling policies, which aimed to promote Japan's whaling industry.

### Resignation

Abe resigned as Prime Minister on August 28, 2020, citing health reasons. He was succeeded by Yoshihide Suga.

Assassination
--------------

Abe was assassinated on July 8, 2022, while campaigning for the LDP in the city of Nara. He was shot twice by a gunman and died shortly after arrival at the hospital.

Controversies and Issues
-------------------------

### Historical Negationism

Abe's government was involved in several historical negationism controversies, including the denial of Japan's role in World War II and the comfort women issue.

### Response to the Mass Media

Abe's government was criticized for its response to the mass media, including the introduction of the "State Secrets Law," which aimed to limit press freedom.

### Yasukuni Shrine

Abe's government was involved in several controversies surrounding the Yasukuni Shrine, a Shinto shrine that honors Japan's war dead, including Class A war criminals.

### Photographs with "731"

Abe was criticized for taking photographs with a group of supporters who wore uniforms with the number "731," which referred to the infamous Unit 731, a Japanese biological warfare unit that conducted human experimentation during World War II.

### Restoration of Sovereignty Day

Abe's government introduced "Restoration of Sovereignty Day," a new national holiday that aimed to promote patriotism and national pride.

### Migratory Policies

Abe's government introduced several migratory policies aimed at increasing immigration and promoting diversity.

Personal Life
-------------

Abe was married to Akie Abe, a former radio DJ and socialite. He had no children.

Legacy
--------

Abe's legacy is complex and multifaceted. He is remembered for his economic policies, known as "Abenomics," and his efforts to promote Japan's role as a global leader. However, his government was also involved in several controversies, including historical negationism and favoritism scandals.

Honors, Awards, and International Recognition
----------------------------------------------

### Domestic Honors

Abe received several domestic honors, including the Grand Cordon of the Order of the Chrysanthemum, Japan's highest honor.

### Foreign Honors

Abe received several foreign honors, including the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the highest civilian honor in the United States.

### Other Honors

Abe received several other honors, including the Order of the Aztec Eagle, Mexico's highest honor, and the Order of the Golden Eagle, Kazakhstan's highest honor.

### Awards

Abe received several awards, including the World Economic Forum's "Global Leader for Tomorrow" award and the Asian Development Bank's "Special Award for Leadership in Regional Cooperation."

### Honorary Doctorates

Abe received several honorary doctorates, including from the University of Cambridge and the University of Oxford.

article:
Sleeping Beauty (1959 film)

Sleeping Beauty is a 1959 American animated fantasy film produced by Walt Disney Productions, based on the fairy tale "La Belle au Bois Dormant" by Charles Perrault and "Little Briar-Rose" by the Brothers Grimm. The film is the 16th Disney animated feature film and is known for its beautiful animation, memorable characters, and iconic music.

# Plot

The film tells the story of Princess Aurora, a beautiful and kind-hearted young woman who is placed under a sleeping curse by the evil fairy Maleficent. The curse is cast after Aurora's parents, King Stefan and Queen Leah, fail to invite Maleficent to their daughter's christening. The curse can only be broken by the kiss of true love.

Aurora is hidden away in the forest by three good fairies, Flora, Fauna, and Merryweather, who raise her as their own. On her 16th birthday, Aurora meets Prince Philip in the forest and falls in love with him. However, Maleficent discovers Aurora's whereabouts and casts a sleeping curse on her, putting the entire kingdom into a deep sleep.

Prince Philip battles Maleficent and her minions to reach Aurora, and with the help of the three good fairies, he is able to break the curse and awaken Aurora with a kiss. The two get married and live happily ever after.

# Voice cast

* Mary Costa as Princess Aurora (speaking voice)
* Helene Stanley as Princess Aurora (singing voice)
* Bill Shirley as Prince Philip (speaking voice)
* Bill Lee as Prince Philip (singing voice)
* Eleanor Audley as Maleficent
* Verna Felton as Flora
* Barbara Luderowski as Fauna
* Barbara Jo Allen as Merryweather
* Taylor Holmes as King Stefan
* Bill Thompson as King Hubert

# Production

## Story development

The development of Sleeping Beauty began in 1951, when Walt Disney first approached his team of writers and animators with the idea of adapting the classic fairy tale into an animated film. The story was developed and refined over the next several years, with Disney himself playing a key role in shaping the narrative and characters.

## Casting

The voice cast for Sleeping Beauty was carefully selected by Disney and his team. article:
Karl R. Free

Karl R. Free was an American artist and muralist, best known for his post office murals created during the 1930s. His artwork often depicted everyday scenes of American life, focusing on the struggles and triumphs of the common man. Free's murals were part of the New Deal's Federal Art Project, an initiative aimed at providing jobs for artists and promoting public art.

#Early years

Karl R. Free was born in 1903 in New York City. He grew up in a family of modest means and developed an interest in art at an early age. Free's parents encouraged his creative pursuits, and he began taking classes at the Art Students League of New York. He studied under prominent artists, including Thomas Hart Benton and Boardman Robinson.

Free's early work was influenced by the Ashcan School, a group of artists known for their realistic and often gritty depictions of urban life. He became particularly interested in the work of John Sloan, who was also an influential figure in the development of the Ashcan School.

#Whitney Museum assistant curator

In the late 1920s, Free began working as an assistant curator at the Whitney Museum of American Art. The museum, founded by Gertrude Vanderbilt Whitney, was dedicated to showcasing the work of American artists. Free's role at the museum allowed him to develop his knowledge of American art and its history.

During his time at the Whitney, Free was exposed to a wide range of artistic styles and movements. He was particularly drawn to the work of the American Regionalists, a group of artists who focused on depicting everyday life in the United States. Free's own artistic style was beginning to take shape, and he became increasingly interested in creating art that reflected the experiences of ordinary Americans.

#Post office murals

In 1935, Free was commissioned to create a series of murals for post offices in Washington, D.C. and Princeton, New Jersey. The murals were part of the Federal Art Project, a New Deal initiative aimed at providing jobs for artists and promoting public art.

##Washington, D.C.

###Creation

Free's mural for the Washington, D.C. post office, titled "The History of the Mail Service," depicted the development of the postal system from colonial times to the present day. The mural was divided into three sections, each showcasing a different era in the history of the mail.

Free spent several months researching the history of the postal system, consulting with historians and studying old photographs and documents. He worked closely with the architect of the post office building, ensuring that the mural would be integrated into the overall design.

###Reception and objections

When "The History of the Mail Service" was unveiled, it received mixed reviews from critics and the public. Some praised the mural for its historical accuracy and attention to detail, while others found it dull and uninspired.

A group of local artists objected to the mural, claiming that it was too conservative and failed to reflect the modern spirit of the city. Free was criticized for his traditional style, which some saw as out of touch with the avant-garde movements of the time.

##Princeton, New Jersey

###Creation

Free's mural for the Princeton post office, titled "The History of Princeton," depicted the town's history from its founding to the present day. The mural was divided into four sections, each showcasing a different era in the town's development.

Free spent several months researching the history of Princeton, consulting with local historians and studying old documents and photographs. He worked closely with the architect of the post office building, ensuring that the mural would be integrated into the overall design.

###Reception and objections

When "The History of Princeton" was unveiled, it received generally positive reviews from critics and the public. The mural was praised for its historical accuracy and attention to detail, and many saw it as a fitting tribute to the town's rich history.

However, some local residents objected to the mural, claiming that it was too focused on the town's colonial past and failed to reflect the diversity of the present-day community. Free was criticized for his depiction of African Americans, who were shown in subordinate roles.

#1939 and beyond

In 1939, Free's contract with the Federal Art Project came to an end. He continued to work as an artist, creating murals and paintings for private clients. Free's style continued to evolve, and he became increasingly interested in abstract expressionism.

During World War II, Free worked as a camouflage artist, using his skills to design camouflage patterns for military equipment and vehicles. He also created propaganda posters and other artwork to support the war effort.

In the post-war period, Free's artwork fell out of favor, and he struggled to make a living as an artist. He continued to work, however, and his artwork experienced a revival in the 1970s and 1980s.

Roswell Incident

The Roswell incident is one of the most enduring and intriguing UFO stories of all time, and has become a cultural phenomenon. The incident occurred in July 1947, when a strange object crashed on a ranch near Roswell, New Mexico. The US military initially reported that they had recovered a "flying disc," but later claimed it was a weather balloon. 1947 Military Balloon Crash

On July 8, 1947, a strange object crashed on a ranch near Roswell, New Mexico. The US military was informed, and a team was sent to investigate. Initially, the military reported that they had recovered a "flying disc," which sparked widespread media attention. However, just one day later, the military retracted their statement, saying that the object was actually a weather balloon that had been found.

The incident was soon forgotten, but it would later become the focal point of numerous conspiracy theories. The US military's initial report of a "flying disc" had sparked the imagination of the public, and many people began to speculate about the true nature of the object.

Despite the US military's explanation that the object was a weather balloon, many people continued to speculate about the true nature of the incident. In the years following the incident, numerous conspiracy theories emerged, including claims of extraterrestrial life and government cover-ups.

### Aztec Crashed Saucer Hoax

One of the earliest and most influential UFO conspiracy theories was the Aztec crashed saucer hoax. In 1948, a man named Silas Newton claimed that he had discovered a crashed UFO in Aztec, New Mexico. Newton's story was widely publicized, and it helped to fuel the public's fascination with UFOs.

In the 1990s, the US Air Force responded to the Roswell conspiracy theories by releasing a series of reports and documents. The reports claimed that the object that had crashed in Roswell was a top-secret balloon reconnaissance project called "Project Mogul."

The reports also claimed that the US military had recovered a number of anthropomorphic dummies that had been used in parachute tests, which had been mistaken for alien bodies.

Another influential book on the Roswell incident was "The Day After Roswell," written by Philip J. Corso. The book claimed that the US military had recovered a crashed UFO and was studying it in secret.

article:
American Idol Season 21

American Idol is an American singing competition television series created by Simon Fuller. The show's 21st season premiered on February 19, 2023, and concluded on May 21, 2023. The season was hosted by Ryan Seacrest and featured Katy Perry, Luke Bryan, and Lionel Richie as judges.

#Auditions

The auditions for Season 21 took place from August 2022 to November 2022 in various cities across the United States. The judges traveled to cities including Los Angeles, California; New York City, New York; Nashville, Tennessee; and Las Vegas, Nevada, among others. The auditions were also held online through the show's website and social media platforms.

During the auditions, contestants had to perform a song of their choice in front of the judges. The judges then provided feedback and decided whether to send the contestant to the next round or eliminate them from the competition.

#Hollywood Week

Hollywood Week took place from November 2022 to December 2022 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, California. The contestants who made it through the auditions round were invited to participate in Hollywood Week, where they had to compete in various challenges and performances.

The first challenge was the " Genre Challenge", where contestants were divided into groups based on their preferred genre of music. They then had to perform a song within their genre in front of the judges. The judges then selected the top contestants from each genre to move on to the next round.

The next challenge was the "Duet Challenge", where contestants were paired up with another contestant to perform a duet. The judges then selected the top duos to move on to the next round.

The final challenge was the " Solo Challenge", where contestants had to perform a solo song in front of the judges. The judges then selected the top contestants to move on to the next round.

#Showstopper Round

The Showstopper Round took place on December 2022 at the Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles, California. The contestants who made it through Hollywood Week were invited to participate in the Showstopper Round, where they had to perform a song of their choice in front of the judges.

The judges then selected the top contestants to move on to the next round based on their performances.

#Top 26 (April 16 & 17)

The Top 26 contestants were revealed on April 16, 2023. The contestants were divided into two groups and performed on two separate nights. The first group performed on April 16, 2023, and the second group performed on April 17, 2023.

The contestants performed a song of their choice, and the judges provided feedback. The contestants with the lowest number of votes were eliminated, and the remaining contestants moved on to the next round.

#Top 20 (April 23 & 24)

The contestants performed a song of their choice, and the judges provided feedback. The contestants with the lowest number of votes were eliminated, and the remaining contestants moved on to the next round.

The contestants performed, and the judges provided feedback. The contestants with the lowest number of votes were eliminated, and the remaining contestants moved on to the next round.

The Top 3 contestants performed on May 21, 2023. The contestants performed three songs each, including a song of their choice, a song chosen by the judges, and a song that would be their winner's single.

The contestants performed, and the judges provided feedback. The contestant with the lowest number of votes was eliminated, and the remaining two contestants moved on to the final round.

The winner of Season 21 was announced at the end of the night, and the contestant was crowned the winner of American Idol.

Bigg Boss (Tamil TV series) season 7

Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 is the seventh season of the Indian reality television series Bigg Boss Tamil, which is based on the Dutch series Big Brother. The show premiered on 3 October 2021 on Star Vijay and was hosted by Kamal Haasan. The show consisted of 22 housemates, who lived together in a custom-built house with cameras and microphones recording their actions 24/7.

# Production

## Eye logo

The eye logo of Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was unveiled on 26 September 2021, which was designed by the show's creative team. The logo featured a stylized eye with a Tamil script font, which represented the show's theme of " observation and surveillance".

## House themes

The Bigg Boss house for season 7 was designed with a theme of luxury and comfort. The house was divided into two sections: the Luxury House and the Small House.

### Luxury house

The Luxury House was designed with a contemporary theme, featuring modern furniture and amenities. The house had a large living area, a kitchen, a dining area, and five bedrooms. The house also had a garden, a swimming pool, and a gym.

### Small house

The Small House, also known as the "Chinna Boss" house, was designed with a minimalist theme. The house was smaller in size compared to the Luxury House and had basic amenities. The house had a small living area, a kitchen, and two bedrooms.

## Concept

The concept of Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was to observe the behavior of the housemates in a controlled environment. The show's makers aimed to test the housemates' physical and mental strength, as well as their social skills and relationships.

## Teaser

The teaser of Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was released on 26 September 2021, which featured a montage of the housemates and the show's host, Kamal Haasan. The teaser hinted at the show's theme of "observation and surveillance".

## Voting process

The voting process for Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 was done through the show's mobile app and website. Viewers could vote for their favorite housemates to save them from eviction.

## Release

Bigg Boss Tamil season 7 premiered on 3 October 2021 on Star Vijay, with a grand opening ceremony. The show was hosted by Kamal Haasan, who introduced the 22 housemates and explained the show's concept and rules.

article:
Stephen "tWitch" Boss
====================

Stephen Laurel "tWitch" Boss was an American dancer, choreographer, actor, television host, and streamer. He was best known for his work as a runner-up on season 4 of the dance competition series So You Think You Can Dance and as a co-host of the daytime talk show The Ellen DeGeneres Show.

Early Life
-----------

Stephen Laurel Boss was born on September 29, 1982, in Montgomery, Alabama. He began dancing at a young age and attended Lee High School in Montgomery, where he was an active member of the school's dance team. After high school, Boss moved to Los Angeles to pursue a career in dance.

Career
--------

### So You Think You Can Dance

In 2008, Boss auditioned for season 4 of the dance competition series So You Think You Can Dance. He made it to the finals and finished as a runner-up, losing to Joshua Allen. Despite not winning the competition, Boss's appearance on the show helped launch his career as a dancer and choreographer.

After his appearance on So You Think You Can Dance, Boss went on to work as a dancer and choreographer for various artists, including Beyoncé, Justin Timberlake, and Ciara. He also appeared as a guest choreographer on several episodes of So You Think You Can Dance and worked as a judge on the show's spin-off series, So You Think You Can Dance: Next Generation.

### Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings

In 2018, Boss joined the Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings team as a host and choreographer. He worked with couples to create custom wedding dance routines and appeared on several episodes of the show.

Personal Life
-------------

Boss was married to Allison Holker, a fellow dancer and choreographer whom he met on So You Think You Can Dance. The couple had two children together and were known for their energetic and entertaining social media presence.

Death
------

On December 13, 2022, Boss died by suicide at the age of 40. His death was met with an outpouring of tributes and condolences from the dance and entertainment communities.

Filmography
------------

### Film

* 2009: Stomp the Yard 2: Homecoming (actor)
* 2011: Footloose (actor)
* 2013: Step Up Revolution (actor)
* 2014: Step Up: All In (actor)
* 2015: Magic Mike XXL (actor)

### Television

* 2008: So You Think You Can Dance (contestant)
* 2011: So You Think You Can Dance (guest choreographer)
* 2013: So You Think You Can Dance: Next Generation (judge)
* 2014: The Ellen DeGeneres Show (co-host)
* 2018: Disney's Fairy Tale Weddings (host and choreographer)

### Web Series

* 2018: tWitch & Allison's Dance Challenge (co-host)

Awards
------

* 2010: Teen Choice Award for Choice TV Personality (nominee)
* 2014: Teen Choice Award for Choice TV Personality (nominee)

----------
